Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with positive vibe”
Reviews.Author: Krystle26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and has a really food vibe. It is certainly a place where people come to be seen. While this isnt really our "cup of tea" it was good for something different. We spent time by the pool chilling out and did notice that it was surrounded by young beautiful people with salon styled hair. When listening to their conversations we soon realised they were from Hollywood and went there for a pool party type hang out place. The staff are a little snotty but cant complain too much when we got a 2 room upgrade without even asking. Definately recommend for couples but not for young families.

Reviews.Title: “You can feel the history”
Reviews.Author: T-Truss
Reviews.Content: The location here cannot be beaten. Most of the rooms have been renovated and are very neat, clean and spacious. The Lobby and Public Bar is a great place to sit for dinner/drinks and hotel staff are very friendly. Valet is a little pricey at $33 per night and rooms have a well stocked mini-bar. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Glam”
Reviews.Author: Mstyl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel (Cabana Garden Room) for approx. a week in Nov 2011. My partner and I were recently married, and upon hearing this, the staff organized a complimentary bottle of champagne for us in our room. A very nice touch. The service was top notch, from the front desk clerks, to the restaurant/bar staff and in particular, the incredibly nice/helpful valet staff - who were always asking if we needed any assistance and gave us suggestions on where to go. I would suggest that if you don't mind paying a bit extra, to book their signature cabana rooms. My partner is bit of a light sleeper, so we decided to go with the cabana (garden), otherwise I would have personally opted for a balcony/poolside cabana, as it is in the centre of all the party/action (esp. during the weekends). Nevertheless, our room was nicely furnished - modern and pretty chic - and also a balcony that overlooked the garden/courtyard. The only downside was the bathroom, which was on the small side. In terms of food and drinks, the burgers and fries were great at 25 Degrees, and the Library Bar - which is situated in the classic lobby - served decent drinks. Unfortunately, we did not really spend too much time at the Tropicana bar, as we were out exploring most of the time. On the one night that we decided to stay in and visit the bar, they had a private function - so unfortunately it was closed off. Apart from that, the hotel is a great place for those wanting to experience the old Hollywood-style glamour, and great for tourists, as it is just opposite the Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and tour buses. Will definitely return the Hollywood Roosevelt hotel when I visit LA again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timdrake42
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt every time I stay in Hollywood. The staff is fantastic! The in hotel restaurants are excellent! (especially 25*) The Roosevelt is in the perfect location on Hollywood Blvd. It is close to everything you want to see. Make sure to make The Roosevelt your stay when you come to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Much More Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: MontanaIrish
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Tripadvisor before traveling and thought that it would be a nice hotel in a fairly nice neighborhood, but didn't realize it was so close to everything Hollywood. The Hotel is ornate and a bit weathered, but adds to the nostalgia. I read reviews where the bathrooms were tiny, and they were, but for us it added to the charm of the hotel. I would make sure that your room isn't over the bar/nightclub downstairs, as we were on the 2nd floor (3rd floor, but directly above street level) and the music played loud until 2am on a Wednesday night. Outside of that, the staff was very helpful and willing to go out of their way to assist. We did not eat at the Hotel or go to the bar, so I can't speak to that. We arrived on a Tuesday night, checked in, rested for a couple hours and then headed out to see what was around. I knew some reviews said Grumann's Chinese Theater was near, but didn't realize it was practically right across the street, along with the Kodak Theater (where the Oscar's are) and the Kodak Mall, which has nice shops and restaurants, and a place way in the back where you can take your won picture with the Hollywood sign in the background without any obstruction. We were able to watch the Red Carpet for two movie premiere's, which was a great experience for our 16 year old daughter, and us as well. It was great to be right in the action of the red carpet. This is also very close to some great restaurants within walking distance and we felt safe in the neighborhood walking around at night, as long as there were crowds around, which is pretty late. It's also about a 10 minute drive to Universal Studios Hollywood, so made for a great location to get around to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Krystle M
Reviews.Content: We only came to stay for one day on a Sunday so this review pertains to the room and room service. I have no doubt that the bar is as fun as many of the reviewers say. But the rooms are pretty awful and need some major updating. We stayed in room 309. The girl who checked us in told us we were "upgraded" to a larger room, which was nice. The room had stains on the carpet, the TV was tiny--too small considering how far away from the bed it was, someone did a terrible job of painting the bathroom door-- they couldn't stay in the lines, the shower was grungy. No bueno. We ordered room service and I had the fish--halibut. It tasted a bit fishy, definitely not good quality. The room service food was about a 2 overall. I would not stay here again unless they renovated the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared off by outdated reputation.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel is right amongst the action. As older people, we noticed that the hotel seems to cater for the younger brigade. Regardless, we had a quiet and enjoyable time and were not bothered by anyone. Room looked over the pool which is a great spot to relax on a sunny day. Whilst at the pool, it is hard to imaging the mayhem that lies outside. Hollywood Blvd is no longer a place to fear but a place anyone can enjoy. The only problem we encountered were the "Premier" nights at the Chinese Theatre, which made it difficult to get back to the hotel if we had been out and about. No fault of the hotel though. Hundreds lined the Blvd to get a glimpse of whoever it might be going to the particular premier. Fun for them but a pain for us. Summing up, the hotel is in a perfect location for anyone interested in the history of making movies or being right amongst the most famous places in Hollywood. It is also in a great spot for getting "Downtown" via rail $1.50 or Santa Monica / Beverly Hills by bus. Don't bother asking the hotel for a map of the area as they only have a tear off map of LA which requires a microscope to view. I also detected a reluctance to give out any helpful imformation unless there was payment involved. Only sour point. As far as we were concerned, the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel ticks the three boxes. Location, Location & Location.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Tropicana Bar”
Reviews.Author: Cnn2
Reviews.Content: First time in CA. Spent practically a whole day at the Tropicana pool bar...it was a blast and the bartender Jim Likens was freakin awesome. They know how to staff at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: Best experience I have ever had in a hotel bar. Tropicana at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel is the place to visit when vacationing in Los Angeles. The rooms of the hotel could use some improvement but the Tropicana more than makes up for that with it relaxing atmosphere and friendly staff. Ask for a server name Mila- she will make your day!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the pool bar!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt hotel last weekend. We were looking for a fun getaway and had a blast at the pool bar. The Bartender, Jim, was awesome! He was on top of our drink orders and we never had an empty drink in our hands. He rocks!! So much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Historical!”
Reviews.Author: hsbstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights there and we loved it! The hotel went thorugh a massive remodeling but kept it's classy atmorphere! The new beds are very comfortable, the service is good and the food is pretty great! Once it is located right on the hollywood most touristic area - right in froont of the Grauman Chinese and Kodak theatre, I supposed it was noisy, but it's not. One of the trendiest night clubs is located in the premisses, so expect to see a bunch of young people around.

Reviews.Title: “Down to earth cool”
Reviews.Author: JRRenfree
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Tropicana pool bar at the Hollywood Roosevelt I definitely had a preconceived notion of what to expect. But the laid back vibe and old school classic decor was a nice surprise. But probably the best part was the service. In this town a beautiful girl making your drink is no surprise. However Nicole was something beyond in that she had knowledge an skills to match her looks. Probably helped that she's a born and bread girl from the Bronx, being a long time NYC resident myself. Will definitely be going back for the vibe, the drinks, and the conversation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service at the bar”
Reviews.Author: Brian E
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to tell you that I had an awesome experience at your Tropicana pool bar. It was a fairly busy night and the bartender Andrew while making tons of drinks kept taking time to chat with me, welcome me and make me feel at home while on business. I know bartending can be stressful with so many people but he handled it great and kept the drinks flowing. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place but not a 'great' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MattFletcher
Reviews.Content: Location is great, directly opposite the Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Boulevard. The Tropicana pool bar is world famous and cool, if not a little disappointing (it is quite literally a pool bar and nothing more). Hotel service was off-hand and impersonal. Not impolite but also not welcoming. Room was bland and cold. It's also quite a noisy hotel, perhaps because of location but also I think because the last renovation was poorly executed. You can hear noise from the corridor and adjoining rooms. On the plus side, the food was good throughout. Breakfast in "25 degrees" was delicious, especially the house scrambled eggs.!

Reviews.Title: “A Price to Pay for Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: kdvillines
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean, recently renovated room in the heart of a somewhat sleazy, but somehow highly upscale town. The room was small, but everything you could want was there (for a price). The fridge/pantry was will stocked with upper-shelf booze and munchies, with the small sampler bottles of Bacardi Rum starting at $8.00. I highly recommend BYOB. Each room is well equipped with a flat-screen TV, pay-per-view movies, ironing board, and your very own Keurig coffee brewer. Be advised, however, that the Keurig cups will cost you about $3.50 per cup. Thus, if you want â€œcomplementaryâ€� in-room coffee, then bring your own cups. Overall, the hotel is situated at a great location, which you pay dearly for. The property is located right across the street from the Chinese Theater and every hill-top view in Hollywood vistas out towards that red neon sign that says sleaze trap on the outside, but actually means high-class (high-priced) accommodations within.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: snorkel13
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and superb facilities made this hotel worth every penny. Very comfortable room (Garden Cabana near the pool) with king size bed and a large minibar selection which is always a plus! Loved the burgers at the 25 degrees restaurant washed down with a good selection of beers. The hotel bars were also impressive including the Tropicana which, in the evening, attracted an amusing eclectic selection of out of work actors and Hollywood wannabes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hollywood location, many amenities”
Reviews.Author: zbidwell
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Roosevelt Hotel because it is a historical hotel in the area and it has been recommended by multiple travel books and magazines. I thought it would be a great experience...it turned out to be an average hotel stay. To someone considering a stay here for the first time, I would say yes so that one can experience the hotel. The pool area and historic reception area are certainly areas to see (although one can visit those two places without staying at the hotel). If I were staying the area again, I probably would consider elsewhere since there are a lot of unique hotels in the Hollywood / Beverly Hills area. Service - We checked in at about 10:30 PM on a Friday evening. Surprisingly, there were several other people checking in at this time so the reception area was busy. The person that checked us in wasn't the most personable - a quality I expected at this place. He seemed a bit rushed and preoccupied. Everyone else we encountered that was employed by the property was much more friendly. Valet parking people were always prompt and efficient in the tight vehicle quarters that the hotel has. Location - As the hotel is located right on Hollywood Boulevard and just steps from the central attractions on Hollywood Boulevard, I could think that there are only a one or two other hotels with equal or better locations. Amenities - We did not have time to use the hotel amenities as we were busy checking out Hollywood and Beverly Hills during our two night stay. From a walk-through, the property was nicely maintained. The pool area was clean and organized. The eating and drinking places on the property all seemed to be top quality and attract several people not staying at the hotel on the weekend evenings. Room - Probably the most unimpressive part about the stay was the room. We stayed in a Queen Superior room and it was probably one of the smallest rooms I've stayed in the U.S. I realize that this is an old property, so that would kind of be expected. By the time two people fit two suitcases and other belongings in the room, it proved to be very tight. We were also given a room that was on the back of the hotel, third floor - which conveniently overlooked a roof, so we couldn't see anything. I'm sure there are a lot of good rooms - more decent size and better views. I suspect that I was given a "cheaper" room in my mind because I booked at discounted rate on a separate travel website.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, old rooms”
Reviews.Author: debbietravels510
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the 2nd time hoping to get a better experience in what is supposed to be a boutique hotel with a modern vibe. Paper thin walls,could here every word the guest in the next room said..makes sleep impossible as hallways are noisy as well. Public Restaurant was also a disappointment, waste of money, time and calories. Pool area a good vibe but don't stay in one of the rooms poolside as its noisy ALL night long! Better choice would be the W Westwood or Hollywood. At check,out the staff don't date ask how your stay was and I doubt they care.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, location not so much”
Reviews.Author: Jody H
Reviews.Content: Having never been to California, we thought staying in Hollywood would be like staying in Times Square in New York, we were wrong. The hotel was much more expensive than the Paris in Las Vegas (where we stayed prior to coming to LA) and it had less amenities. This hotel is also very loud as apparently it doubles as a lounge/night club at night. The biggest disappointment was staying on Hollywood Blvd, nothing like we thought it would be. It was more dirty and run down than it appears on TV with lots of bums and boarded up shops. There's not really much to do around here once you see the Chinese Theater and Kodak Theater. If I could do it over again, I would probably stay somewhere closer to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Tropicana Pool Bar”
Reviews.Author: Kim N
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to go the the Roosevelt Hotel and I finally did! The hotel was great and you can not beat the location, right in the middle of all of the attractions. My girlfriends and I had an amazing time at the Tropicana Pool Bar, it was busy but the bartender Andrew could not have been more polite and attentive to the waiting customers. We had a great trip and plan to make it a yearly girls trip!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Collin D
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work, and this hotel is by far the best I've encountered. The entire staff is wonderful; everyone went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my stay. The rooms are great and have a 'home-y' feeling. The location is amazing, being in walking distance of so many things. I can't even come up with one bad thing about my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Haven”
Reviews.Author: BuddysList
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel last minute, without anytime to review and it ended up being one of the best nights we had on our eight day trip to southern California. The hotel is directly on the Hollywood walk of fame with major Hollywood attractions all within walking distance. We were so happy to leave our car parked ( driving around SoCal is nerve wracking) and spent the evening walking around. Returned to the Roosevelt to have a drink at their stunningly gorgeous pool area with comfy chairs and fire pits illuminating the palms. Dinner was at their restaurant/pub 25 degrees.....another wonderful surprise to find inexpensive food that was delicious! The staff were so accommodating and gracious and the concierge went out of his way to google best directions for us to avoid the notorious California Freeways. The ambience is romantic with tufted dark red leather chaise lounges and club chairs scattered around the marbled and tiled foyers and lounge areas. This hotel is 4 star quality with many 5 star attributes, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Oscar trip”
Reviews.Author: Shirley P
Reviews.Content: Had a great time celebrating my birthday and the oscars - lots going on and the hotel was beautiful. Front desk staff, especially Brett, and valet service was great. Hotel was crowded and very busy, getting around was a little tricky oscar weekend, but staff made it much easier. Do wish dual beds were available by pool as i was traveling with a friend and we didnt want to share bed. Only real downside was getting the accounting staff to return call about a billling issue - still haven't heard from them after two requests in person and three phone messages.

Reviews.Title: “Great boulevard experience”
Reviews.Author: Bk9er
Reviews.Content: Loved the Tropicana bar. The waitress Elaine was great.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rod W
Reviews.Content: I found the Roosevelt Hotel to be just o.k. The location was good for tourists to have a look around the immediate area. The pool area was great. The suite I had was clean and tidy, yet very noisy at night time. This Hotel has some great history, yet I probably wont be rushing back.

Reviews.Title: “Best drinks by the BEST bartender”
Reviews.Author: Jenn M
Reviews.Content: Screaming with Hollywood swank and history, the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel hosts a few bars but the best bartender in Hollywood happens to work at the Tropicana bar. Jim, not only adorable and friendly, makes killer drinks. Each time I make it out to Hollywood I stop by this bar. Being poolside is a nice perk, especially in the Summer. No matter how busy the place is, Jim always makes sure to check on you or chat for a second, even if your drink is half full. If you are looking a a great place to get a burger, ask Jim, he seems to know all the great places and make awesome recommendations. I will definitely be going back next time I am in Hollywood and will be bringing friends.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hollywood style”
Reviews.Author: picnicjones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably worth booking if you can get a deal. I went with three other girls (ages 28-35) my cousins for a weekend and this was perfect. The rooms opened up together though mine was a bit smaller than I would have liked for the price. However the Library bar was great and the lobby so old hollywood I really felt as if Betty Davis or Montgomery Ward might walk through while we sipped our fantastic fresh Ginger cocktails. The breakfast was good too and you know if you're not too cool for school than it's fun to be steps away from the Kodak Theater and the other hollywood landmarks. No free coffee though but the CC Bigalowe bath products were fun and unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Evening_Thanks to the Bartender”
Reviews.Author: DanielA1384
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of visiting the world famous Roosevelt in Hollywood. It was definitely surpassed my expecations of what I had heard to be the Roosevelt. We made our way through the lobby and with a friends recommendation we made our way to the pool. Once at the pool we made our way to the bar to begin our night with a nice cocktail. At the bar we were greated by the Bartender whose name was Andrew Frischerz. Andrew greeted us with a nice big smile and eventhough it was a packed house he took the time to greet us and introduce himself as if we had stopped in at a dive bar. This is what stood out to us. He was very personal and quick making sure that everyone at the bar was being taken care of. Each time I made my way to the bar he would address me by my last name, name on my card, and would ask if I would care of another. Coming from South America, Andrew gave us great insight as to what the locals are up to and what the toursist do. Ive had the pleasure to travel the world and stay at many great places. Andrew's fantastic customer service and personality is what makes certain hotels stand out. I will recommend the Pool Bar at the Roosevelt to all my friends who come to LA and make sure they have the pleasure to speak with Andrew and get a great insight to the Los Angeles scene! -DRA

Reviews.Title: “(Sung in Falsetto)....AWWWWWWWsommme!”
Reviews.Author: P-Hopper
Reviews.Content: Due to a snafu, we were lucky enough to stay here. We were on the top floor overlooking the pool. Night time works it's magic on L.A. and the view of the city twinkling away is just divine. Especially if you are feasting on a fresh fruit platter with a glass of wine in your hand. Having two shower/bath areas is simply genius, definitely shaving off time it would take to get ready for a big night on the town. And let's just be clear, the town is right on your doorstep. The Kodak Theatre is just a few steps away. Sometimes "boutique" hotels trade on the name but let you down in the actuality. I didn't get the feeling that this place was slacking in any way. Rooms were clean, crisp and bathrooms very, very chic (although dark). I kept feeling that although modern, Cary or Marilyn might walk in at any moment demanding the starring role in the next screenplay on the coffee table. Phwar! The staff was very friendly. Not a hint of the snobbies, noooo that is reserved for some of the guests, those with rolling accounts, and those 'wanna-be's" and "may-be's" and other assorted posers who were breaking their necks to see and be seen. You have to be in the mood for it... cause if you aren't strutting it or working hard to not strut it... you'll definitely overdose on the self propelled hype of the patrons. Take it in stride. It is funny watching everyone work hard at being Hollywood. Get there early, stake out a place at the bar and I guarantee you, the antics are more entertaining than reality tv. In fact, I've said it here first. If I find my idea makes it to the little screen. I want a cut. :) Now, back to the rooms. Dark, minimalist, with white sheets/duvet. Furnishings are modern/retro/minimalist. Flat screen television that I never touched, cause I was at the LIbrary downstairs. Heh-heh. Great mini-bar selections. Although it pisses me off to stay in an expensive place and find they want to gouge me for the water. Come on!. Absolutely fantastic place to go when you want to see and be seen, find some footprints at Grauman's, and soak up some L.A. vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meg704
Reviews.Content: Staff were brilliant! VEry helpful and friendly! Great customer service!!! Original room small and comfortable, however they gae us a free upfrade to a studio which was beautiful!!!! :) Highly recommended! Great location for Hollywood! Clean rooms and lovely Hotel. THANK-YOU! :)

Reviews.Title: “Carla Toutz at the Tropicana Bar”
Reviews.Author: Gingiebird
Reviews.Content: Dear people, I wanted to write and let you know that during a particularly challenging visit to Los Angeles I stayed at your hotel. There was a bartender named Carla Toutz she was incredible offering suggestions of drinks, places to go and she made me feel so welcome and cared for. She is such a valued employee. I hope and pray that she has all the success in the world she deserves it! Kind regards, KS

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 1920s hotel with excellent service in the heart of Hollywood transports the guest back in time.”
Reviews.Author: Jfanson
Reviews.Content: Situated across the street from Graumans Chinese Theater, the Roosevelt Hotel is centrally located in the heart of Hollywood. 1920s elegance is combined with modern conveniences and outstanding service to reward the guest with thoroughly enjoyable experience. From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed service was friendly, prompt, and professional. The hotel is beautifully maintained, including the rooms, lobby, and various bars, lounges, and restaurants. We especially enjoyed the Spare Room, complete with bowling lanes to add to the sense of fun. The David Hockney painted swimming pool and surrounding cabana rooms and bar offer a sensuous ambiance. Hotel security even opened up the famous Blossom Room, scene of the 1st Academy Awards, when we requested a peek.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.....if you you're not there to sleep”
Reviews.Author: giggy19
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have become the place in Hollywood to live out the fantasy of being a character in the HBO series Entourage. Or perhaps, to party like a rock star. At 3 am the rooms are buzzing with activity. It seems like a whole lot of fun....except if you're trying to sleep at that hour. Oh how I wish I had a chosen a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Tracy C
Reviews.Content: I want to first say that I have always had a great time at this hotel well before I was ever a guest here. The day and night life are always top notch, the restaurants are great even the 24 hour diner like spot that faced hollywood blvd (great ppl watching any hr of the day or night) and the alcoholic milkshakes are out of this world. The rooms are all updated and contemporary which I like. Recently I came in town for an event and had a few friends coming with we all got our own rooms mine a king suite, theirs standard rooms, we were all happy with the service we received. The ambiance is just fun too! who doesn't like feeling that historical Hollywood vibe? I definate visit if your coming to Hollywood. Oh yeah if your out for a night on the town stop by the Library bar great unique drinks super cute, I had nothing to do one night and had a great time with my girlfriends just sitting there lounging on the couches with some cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “eh...”
Reviews.Author: sethmg
Reviews.Content: room looks nothing like pictures on the internet - i was in what was supposedly a "king deluxe" and it was small, poorly lit, no decoration - just a bed, a desk, a photo on the wall. the bathroom was tiny and not the cleanest. and there was an abundance of hair in the fire/water spout in the ceiling = gross.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_John_C300S
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA for business and my first choice for hotel is always Hotel Roosevelt. For years I've been staying here and every time I enjoy the hotel. With some oversized room and great ambiance, this is truely the hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience!”
Reviews.Author: trifocal3
Reviews.Content: I was told I would be staying at the Hotel Roosevelt, and I immediately checked TripAdvisor to see the reviews. After reading, I was a bit anxious mainly because the majority complain about noise into the late hours of the night. When we got to the hotel, we found it was located directly across the street from the Chinese theatre. There were hundreds of touristy restaurants that you could walk to to get a drink or a bite to eat. Starbucks directly across the street. Inside the hotel is 5 different restaurant/bars to choose from. Valet charges $35 to the room. Really no alternative options. It is a bit weird when you first check in you have to go down 3 or 4 stairs with your luggage. The valet guys try to help but it makes it more awkward. After check in, I went to the elevators (half expecting them to not work from all the reviews) and both elevators seemed to be working fine. My room was older, but in renovated condition. A firm bed and decent bathroom. On the tv was a live feed outside at the Chinese theatre. $5 Fiji bottles of water are strategically placed around the room. I read a bit on the history of the hotel (celebrities that visited like Marilyn Monroe, etc. Stories of certain floors being haunted) and it is easy to start to like this place. I needed to print some documents for a meeting. The lobby has two free internet ($15 in the room) kiosks with a printer attached. I printed a 50 page document and no one blinked an eye...they actually offered me a stapler. At night I fell asleep and didnt hear a peep the entire night. Not even a door slamming shut. It was a Tuesday night, so maybe the bad reviews are only on the weekends, but this was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in LA a lot, and the room was tiny in comparison, but the history makes up for it.”
Reviews.Author: j g
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work, as well as for pleasure, and I have a pretty good idea of typical hotel rooms in different cities, and I do have to say this room was on the smaller side of what I am used to getting while in LA, BUT the history of this hotel, as well as the fun decor make up for it. I really didn't have much interaction with the staff, so I can't say much on how they are, but the room was clean, I was checked in quickly and had no complaints. For whatever reason, even though it was dated, I liked the bathroom in my room, and also appreciated the art work on the walls. Location was good if you are looking to explore the more touristy areas of LA, and the main lobby area is cool to just sit back, have a drink and get comfortable. If you want to stay in someplace rich in Hollywood history, hang out with the hipsters then this is a good choice in hotels for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nickolas K
Reviews.Content: Me & my Fiancee stayed in this hotel for 2 days on our Stopover from Peru back to Australia. We found this hotel online for $135 Per Night and booked it. We booked a room on the twenty-something floor. Upon arriving via ShuttleBus we had our bags whisked away while we checked in. Within 15 minutes we were taken up to our room where our bags were already waiting us and our coats where hanging in the cupboard. The room was VERY clean & the bathroom was immaculate. We went back down to reception to ask for some help as this is our first time in the US let alone LA and we needed to get as much in within 2 days as possible. The hotel staff sat us down with a map, asked us where we wanted to go, gave us bus numbers & times, tips for restraunts and drew locations and infomation on a map for us to get us on our way. This hotel is in an amazing location, overlooking the Chinese Theater & Kodak Theater and 5 minutes walk from Mel's Diner. We didnt have the noise problem when we stayed there - yes we went down the bar downstairs by the pool, but in the room - we couldnt hear a thing. 25 Degrees Burger Joint in the Lobby makes WEAPON burgers... heart attack material... i struggled with it... but naturally, i finished like a boss. Overall; fantastic experience, excellent decor, beautiful clean rooms, affordable price (find it online at discounted rates) and awesome location. We were VERY VERY happy.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Rosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AprilC77
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very beautiful and the view of the city was amazing. The beds were very inviting and the ombions of the room was very welcoming and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “More party than a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBJ
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big, big TV, big bed, great air conditioner, minibar, hairdryer, safe (not so big, if your laptop is to big, it doesn't fit in), iron + board, enough towels, and an alarm with i-pod docking station, phone. If you want a terrace let them know. We had a terrace not to the pool side, it's better if you want to have it not to loud. If you want to make party than take a room to the pool side. It is very much a party hotel and is a bit noisy, we had no problem with that. It's a very stylish hotel with charm. The cleaning staff is very good and nice, safety in the hotel is good, the whole staff is pretty nice and welcoming and helpful. The area around: Taxis are direct in front of the hotel and there are always enough, several bus lines (but sometimes it's confusing when the busses are leaving, the bus stop stations don't have big signs, so you really have to look) Subway is there too, good for a trip to Universal City - there is a free bus waiting and bringing you directly to Universal City. In-N-Out Burger (the best), McDonalds, supermarket Fresh & Easy, pharmacy, Starbucks, Wraps, restaurants, shopping centre Highland Hills (you can see the Hollywood Sign) is all reachable on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great IF you are going for a party atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: krawimi
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Nearly every hotel on TripAvisor has some reviews that complain about noise. The Roosevelt is in a different league. The partying noise (both from other rooms and from the hotel pool bar) was intense until 2 or 3 in the morning. The hallway smelled a bit. One of my colleagues (who was staying in the tower) said it was quieter, but had a problem with the elevator (a common theme in other reviews). On the positive side, the staff was great, incredibly professional and helpful. They offered to move my room when I mentioned that it was very, very loud. The look of the hotel is also great. The location is good for touristy things.

Reviews.Title: “Almost got assaulted at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisac2333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt in May of 2011 for a conference. It is super trendy, and in a good location but the rooms were a little dated, and the staff was kind of pretentious. For some reason I was on the party floor and was woken up quite often to the sounds of dance parties going on next door. That wasn't such a big deal - as I had somewhat expected it from this hotel. If it wasn't for an incident that happened in the Lobby of my last night in the Hotel I would have rated this Hotel about a 3 - 3.5. My last night staying at the Roosevelt I went to dinner in Santa Monica. Upon my return (around 10pm) The lobby and bars were crowded with people drinking and hanging out. I noticed a strange man hanging out by the elevators and was a little nervous to get on. I walked around the lobby a bit to see if he would leave but he didn't. Finally, I decided he had been sitting there for awhile (at the time I thought maybe he was waiting for someone) so I went ahead and waited for my elevator. As soon as I got on the elevator (which requires your room key to use in the evening) this man jumps up from his seat and comes running into the elevator with me. In a panic I started to run off of the elevator - he then tried to grab my arm and pull me back in. Luckily I got off the elevator and alerted security. They didn't seem to take it too seriously, but clearly this man was NOT a guest at the Hotel, and had some sort of ulterior motive for trying to get upstairs to the hotel rooms. Thank god I had the sense to get off that elevator, who knows what would have happened if I did not!

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel, Hollywood, you can do better.”
Reviews.Author: Musicbiztraveler
Reviews.Content: Been here three days and only one of the hotel's two elevators has worked the entire time. On top of that the elevator that does "work" frequently doesn't respond to guest's key cards (which are required for guest floor access) so the whole car full of people rides up to the top floor with frustrated guests who then exit as the elevator works its way back down. And stairways are not an option, emergency exit only. If you do stay here don't stay on any floor below six or you'll feel the bass rumble from the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame”
Reviews.Author: T0ny1962
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Hollywood blvd, and that's it's best asset. The history of the hotel is all it can live on, the rooms are dated and the carpets in all areas are disgusting.Most areas are dark and only one lift was working,and that seemed to be struggling with the demand. The hotel looks great from the outside,worth a visit for the history, but would not want to stay again. On a positive note, the bell men and receptionists were very good and helpful and the staff in general are good, and the hotel is on the walk of fame and 2 mins from Chinese and Kodak theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decor. Clientele, eh...”
Reviews.Author: wabitop
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is conveniently located right on Hollywood Boulevard which means you can actually do some sightseeing on foot. A rarity of course in LA. The hotel gives you a taste of old hollywood and the staff are very courteous. The rooms are small but comfortable. Only gripe is the very loud AC.

Reviews.Title: “I can imagine in its day this hotel would have oozed true Hollywood glamour.”
Reviews.Author: bella072
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt has glimpses of "old hollywood glamour " until you get to your room. The rooms could well do with a refresh and the bathroom is as small as i have experienced anywhere. The hotel is in a great location if you are only in LA for a short time, as we were. On check-in i got the feeling that attention to details was not been displayed, i was right , a few days later found we had been charged even though room had been paid for weeks before by travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time at this Hotel - still amazing!”
Reviews.Author: beqbeq
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time with friends from late October to November and absolutely loved it. The hotel again is situated in a great location - a central point to all the sites. We stayed here for Halloween and it was insane. It was the best experience of my life! We went to the Halloween party at the hotel which was fantastic and we also partied heavily for Halloween on Hollywood Blvd which was also amazing! We stayed in a Junior Suite and it was a great size and provided great views. I would highly recommend this hotel - in particular during Halloween because like I said the party they throw is amazing and the parties just outside the hotel are even better. It's in a perfect location for Halloween fun and the way the hotel does itself up for Halloween is incredible. Love the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience! Worst hotel I stayed at all year.”
Reviews.Author: AVeryPickyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for this hotel. I was on a week and a half long swing through California and decided to stay here while in Hollywood. I love historic hotels, so this was going to be one of the hotels I was most looking forward to. This hotel claims to be a luxurious class of hotel ... I found it to be everything but. For tourists who (for some reason) want to stay close to the drag queen hookers, pan handlers, drug addicts and cheesy t-shirt shops that is Hollywood Boulevard, it is a great location. But aside from being right across the street from the Walk of Fame and the famous Chinese Theater (which is a curse and a blessing), this hotel was one of the WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCES I HAD ALL YEAR! First of all, there is almost NO service attitude here. The hotel hires the typical 'Hollywood type' ... young, attractive with an attitude. Almost every staff member I encountered at this hotel had a terrible attitude. They really seem put out having to work there and treat the guests rudely. When I went to the concierge desk (a late 20s - early 30s guy) he didn't even look up at me while I was asking him a question. He was writing some notes and kept his head down the whole time and answered in short, clipped sentences. And gave me some pretty bad recommendations to boot. I reserved a suite and asked if they had any upgrades for frequent Thompson guests while checking in. I was told that the room was upgraded already, which I thought was good. Until I got to the room and found out it was exactly the type of room I booked. When I called down and asked about this they explained that the 'upgrade' was that I was put on a high floor. Hmmm ... I didn't realize that a hotel upgrade literally meant 'up on a higher floor'. Even the bartenders had a 'dude, im going to be a famous actor one day, don't bother me' vibe. The single biggest rip off in this hotel is the Beacher's Madhouse scam. The only time the staff here go out of their way is to hawk this terrible club. Apparently, someone figured out along the line that Teddy's (the now closed for rennovation uber-guest list club in the Roosevelt) was a great way to get young 20 something year old drunken LA kids to wait in line to pay $15 for a beer. So, they opened Beecher's Madhouse and paid Kelly Osbourne (previously David Duquette until he bailed) to put her name on it. Beachers claims to be sold out for years in advance. However ... surprise ... surprise ... they slide fliers under every hotel guest's door that offer the the opportunity to get into Beachers for $150 cover ... or $500 - $5000 for table service (alchohol not included). I peeked into the club (know some people in LA who got me in free) and it seemed like it was 'over the top' crazy ... as if someone on acid designed a club and put things in for shock value. Maybe cool for the first 5 minutes but after that, you would need to take acid to forget how much you paid to get in. Total scam. One thing I was VERY dissapointed with is that the hotel is PACKED full of non-hotel guest 20 something year old Jersey Shore kids. They are all drinking at the clubs and bars ... decked out in their True Religion jeans and high hooker heels ... hanging out in the lobbies taking up all the furniture in the public spaces and swearing like truckers/sailors. Def. not a place I would EVER bring a family. The public spaces are nice (if you can get past the jersey shore trash all over the place) and are made up to look like 1920s Hollywood with big tufted leather couches and dark wooden beams and ornate painted ceilings. There are bars everywhere ... it didn't take me long to figure out this hotel caters to the young, jet set party crowd. The pool is awesome, but is almost always closed for photo shoots. At night the best time to go is around dusk when they turn the space heaters and firepits on and it is not crowded with the Situation and JWoww look-a-likes making out on couches. However, $15 for a mixed drink served out of a plastic cup or $8 for a beer is a bit much to charge. And the fact that most nights the pool bar closes at 10 p.m. in order to give business to Beacher's Madhouse is lame. As for the room ... again, think young, hip 20 something crowd. The walls and ceilings of the hallways are painted dark grey so it looks like you are walking down the hallway of a haunted house. There are paparazzi photos on the wall in black and white. We had a suite, which was very spacious but it almost felt like someone moved a ton of furniture out. There was a small coffee table, cheap looking microsuede couch, and a mini-bar with no coffee maker. The bedroom had a bed and a tv stand and a night stand. There was TONS of empty space in the room where most hotels would have put an arm chair in the bedroom. It was obvious they saved money on furniture by making the rooms empty and cavernous. We saw the maid cleaning a standard room and were literally amazed at the size of the rooms ... they looked like a closet. Smaller than a dorm room at a city college ... seriously, you really need to re-think booking a regular room unless you don't mind a closet with a bed. The bathroom was incredibly small. Literally the toilet/sink were in a space the size of an airplane bathroom. There was a shower/tub with cheesy tile walls and half a glass partition which made the floor all wet anytime you took a shower. The view from the hotel was good, overlooking the Hollywood sign and Walk of fame. There was no car service and cabs are pricey in LA. Parking was expensive as well ... I might be inclined to skip the valet and park my car elsewhere to save time and $15 - $20 per day. There are nice, safe places for $10 per day in the area. Overall, this was a very dissapointing experience. The room was cheap looking ... drab, depressing and dark. The service was beyond reprehensible ... rude and non-existant. At $200 - $350 per night, they have a lot of nerve to provide such bad service. The only good part of the hotel is the lobby area and pool area, which is unavailable at night because of all the drunk club kids taking up space before leaving the hotel after the clubs close. There should be a guests only area/lobby. This was a total dissapointment. If I had it to do over I would have booked at the Rennasaince across the street, which is cleaner, nicer and doesn't have a Jersey Shore infestation. Or the Hollywood Hills Hotel. Avoid the Roosevelt. I am very dissapointed in Thompson as a frequent guest to the brand and very dissapointed at the management of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster dofyi”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: Great historic hotel that has had its soul ripped out. The lobby was saved but that is all that is left of this great historic property. Hallways painted black, fluorescent sofit lighting in the rooms and mattresses mounted on plywood frames. What a shame. This hotel has succumbed to the trends of the day and ruined this great property with tasteless decorating. The fluorescent lighting in the rooms has all the charm of a KMart store. The black painted walls in the hallways make you feel like you are in a hipster night club. Yuck. Luckily they were able to save the lobby, but it is furnished like some sort of McMansion, instead of the proud Spanish colonial master piece that it is. Overall this is a great building Ina great location, hopefully someday they will furnish it accordingly and return it to its glory.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Service non-existent”
Reviews.Author: 0_Cabin_Fever4
Reviews.Content: I took my family (3 young kids) for their first trip to Hollywood, and although I knew that reality would never meet their expectations, I didn't realize by how much. Although many other reviews expound the location of the Roosevelt, I found that Hollywood Boulevard is a pretty seedy areas dominated by souvenir shops and touts trying to sell you tours of celebrity houses. If I go back I will probably avoid this area. The hotel is quite fashionable with low lighting dark themes, and the room we stayed in was impressively large (good size for a family of 5) with 2 bathrooms and comfortable beds. Unfortunately that's where the positives stop. The air conditioning units are so loud we had to shut them off when we slept. One night I called room service to replenish the coffee (there is no free coffee or tea by the way), and bring up some wine glasses. They never came. We ended up falling asleep waiting for them. The next morning we had breakfast in the burger restaurant, and they completely stuffed up our order a couple of times, left things off, and served a cold breakfast....no applogies. They obviously knew that our tip would reflect the service so automatically added 18%, which they did not do the previous morning. Just to compound things, only 1 of the 2 lifts was in working order, so it took at least 10 minutes to get to and from our room each time, longer if you had bags are we were unable to squeeze in. Overall quite disappointed, and next time I will stay in Beverly Hills or Santa Monica beach.

Reviews.Title: “Location only”
Reviews.Author: MMMc55
Reviews.Content: The location and history of this hotel is brilliant. Brilliant for proximity to all the Hollywood icons, across the road from the Chinese Theatre, on the Walk of Fame, a very short walk to the Metro that takes you one stop to Universal Studios, to lots of restaurants and shops. Brilliant for Hollywood history buffs, the hotel is steeped in history associated with movie stars and the Academy Awards. That said, it seems to have very little interest in guests who have chosen to stay there who are not part of the latest fashion shoot, TV shoot or party animals getting drunk around the pool. We booked a room, through an agency, which was supposed to ajoin the garden or pool area. The room was not cheap, I had previously stayed there in a similar room a few years ago. After checking in we were shown to a room on the 1st floor overlooking a car park at the rear of the property. After reading more recent reviews of the hotel I was alert to the many complaints and chose to complain up front and be quite ascertive that this was NOT the room I had booked and paid for. The desk clerk was not so much apologetic but quickly assigned another room, which was all he could offer, another first floor one, this time with a balcony overlooking the garden and similar in design as the one I had booked over the net. Be alert to what you have booked and be ready to grumble. Not really what you'd like to expect for the prices they charge here. This hotel features more and more on video clips, MTV, ET, E! News, Entourage and other pop culture outlets and as a guest you get a sense that this is where the Roosevelt's priorities lie. You will pay for its 'coolness' and not for what should be its more worthy qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: E P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt hotel over the holidays. The staff was extremely friendly and always helpful whenever we had a question or needed anything. The only good restaurants within a 6- block radius were in the lobby of this hotel. 25 Degrees was a great place for a burger and Public Kitchen and Bar had a fantastic French Bistro meets American country vibe to it. The reason I docked this hotel one rating was that the common hallways were very dark (too dark to navigate) the rooms were a little tired and could use some sprucing up and at various points throughout our stay, the elevators were down and we had to take the stairs a few times. I definitely would come back to this hotel, especially if they brightened up their rooms and got some non-west elm-looking furniture in there. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “company Christmas party”
Reviews.Author: ToshaShea
Reviews.Content: I have yet to stay there but I've been for an evening party and once just passing through and staff are extremely professional and kind, all facilities were clean and classy, and catered event food was, for the most part, very tasty. We had a casino-themed party and everyone had a blast! It was quite a hit with the company taking over a couple of ballrooms. I would definitely recommend this spot for a company party or any event, and the downstairs bar is so ritzy! Also, you're right off the walk of fame and a gazillion tourist attractions. Only negative I could see would be... traffic on weekends (which you will have anywhere in metro LA)

Reviews.Title: “Take this hotel only for the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: matsnen
Reviews.Content: During 4days stay only one elevator was working. You can imagine the stress staying on 11th floor. The hotel is very dark with few lights that gives a dungeon experience and during daylight you can see all the dirt on floors and corners. The A/C is noisy and trafic sound could be heard all night so bring your ear plugs with you.

Reviews.Title: “More about style than pracalities”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_family794
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience Hollywood, then this hotel offers a fantastic location. It is right across the road from the Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame. The downside of this is that there is always a crowd right outside for most of the day and night. There are spruikers on microphones and electronic flashing bill boards, lots of traffic and many sirens. It's a hectic and loud area. The hotel itself had positives and negatives for me. On the positive side the pool area is very nice, in fact all of the public areas of the hotel look great and have a very stylish vibe. The decor throughout the hotel, especially the corridors, is dark with dark brown walls and dark wood. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 5th floor and we had problems with the elevators. There were only two lifts servicing our floor, and for our 2 night stay one lift was almost always not working. Also, the 'down' button for the lift on our floor was not working, so we had to board a lift that was going up in order to eventually be able to access the ground floor. It seemed that many other guests had the same gripe as it was a major topic of conversation during the elevator ride. Our room was an adequate size, but the bathroom was very small - to give you an idea the toilet roll holder was on the opposite wall to the toilet but was easily reachable. We had a combined shower/bath with a glass panel. This looked great, but didn't work. Water leaked everywhere and whenever anyone had a shower we ended up with a great puddle of water on the bathroom floor. The shower tap was a 'mixer', but you could only adjust the temperature - the hotter the water the stronger the pressure, you could not reduce the pressure without lowering the temperature. There was also very little space to put any toiletries, and with a family of four, we only had room only for our toothbrushes. Also, there was no window or exhaust fan in the bathroom. Our beds were described as 'two Queen beds' but these were smaller than the Australian-standard Queen size we are used to. They were more like an Australian Double - having said that, the beds were very comfortable. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, but if you are going to stay here it has to be because you want to experience a bit of Hollywood glamour whilst being in the midst of the craziness that is the real Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Roosevelt is ho-hum.”
Reviews.Author: andrawatkins
Reviews.Content: I've staying in many a Thompson Hotel, and I was most disappointed in this one. When we arrived, they had the entire lobby (including the most logical entrance) closed off for a private party, with no signage indicating where we were supposed to go to check in. We ended up wandering around basement corridors until we finally found the front desk. Not a good start. Our room was tiny, even by TH standards, but it lacked the thoughtful amenities that usually mark a Thompson property, like fluffy robes and lotion. The room was also showing its wear. It was always clean, though, and the beds and sheets were comfortable and welcoming. The hotel is well-located. Multiple Hollywood points of interest were within easy walking distance, including the Walk of Fame, the Chinese Theater and shopping. I even walked to Runyon Canyon for some hiking. The restaurants downstairs are both very good, and, when the lobby is open, it's a great space to sit and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AndyPorat
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Room was very nice, clean, quiet, staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast restaurant was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hollywood adventure”
Reviews.Author: sfbec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a great location, across from all the Hollywood delights like the Grauman's Chinese theatre and the walk of fame. You really feel like you are part of Hollywood scene when you stay here, the hotel just oozes history and old Hollywood glamour. Although the accommodation is not cheap, the friendly staff and the service you get are worth the extra cost. I would highly recommend eating at the both the 25 Degrees Restaurant (best burgers EVER) and at The Public Kitchen and Bar. We really enjoyed our stay and will stay here again when we return to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Trevor797
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel dripping with history. Our room was a bit tired but there is no way to be closer to the heart of the action, all the tours and Kodak etc. We were lucky enough to be there when filming was taking place outside the hotel which was exciting.

Reviews.Title: “The Hollywood Experience”
Reviews.Author: Annakatrina
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Roosevelt is an experience. Whether it's a good or bad experience depends on your willingness to accept this hotel for what it is: a glamorous, overcrowded place for people to party. Kind of like the Meatpacking District in New York, before it became really upsetting. The Thompson Hotels slogan is something like, "we treat ordinary people like rock stars and rock stars like ordinary people," and that's the feeling you get here, as parties in the many, many bars and private rooms hidden away in the hotel become louder and crazier as the night wears on. At 5 in the morning, through an adjoining but locked door in my room, I could hear my next door neighbor vomiting loudly, and somehow it didn't annoy me; it seemed like a rock star thing to do. But, as someone who isn't a celebrity, I have no idea if famous people are treated as though they're ordinary. Clearly, this place isn't cheap. If you are paying for something at the Roosevelt, service is excellent and fast. If you want something with no price tag attached, like clean drinking glasses, they will pretend to listen, and never bring the item. The only tip I have to save money is to not use the valet service, with is something like $60 a day, and instead use the parking garage across the street, located under the mall complex next to Grauman's Chinese Theater. It's only $20 a day, with no need to tip anyone. I know that room quality varies at this property, but I loved my room, which had a view of the red carpet outside of Grauman's, where I could see flashbulbs popping nightly. Things were clean, modern, and fun in the room, although beware of the seductive, overstocked and, yes, overpriced mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why this hotel doesn't have a higher rating on here?”
Reviews.Author: El_Pago
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 1 night stay at the Roosevelt during my second visit to Hollywood. The hotel is central to the boulevard and is in great shape! The staff were well presented and very helpful to all our needs. The lobby is charming and you immediately feel as though you are finally in Hollywood! The room was small but ample and the breakfast options were great if you are looking for something tasty before heading on a long road trip to Vegas! The rooftop bar is great (home to all the parties on the Hills TV Show, so i was wrapped to have my poolside cocktails up there and pretend i was Heidi for the night!) I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Hollywood and would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Third room was a charm!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgesSF
Reviews.Content: First room we had was not what was promised. Second room although nice was very noisy. The people in the next room were having a party and we felt as if we were in their room with them. Third room was GREAT!! Everyone was nice and helpful. Food was spectacular and we had brunch with Robert Downey Jr....well not really but he was two table away from us.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Visit, Not a Stay”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is worth a visit inside, visit to the pool and bar, but I can't recommend staying over night. The staff is very helpful but overwhelmed with helping people just visiting the hotel, so why bother staying to wait in line for valet after 20 pool revelers. Adding to this the hotel rooms are very tiny (smallest I have ever seen, even smaller than NY) and terribly outdated with mismatched thrift store furniture. The doors & windows aren't sealed properly allowing in noise from the parties. I have no idea how this hotel is holding on to its 4* rating with their room quality, it is no more than a 3*. We also found no need to stay in this Hollywood area, once you do a quick walk up the street, maybe spend 1/2 hour, it's done. This area is central to drive everywhere else, but there's no need to stay in this area and certainly not at this hotel, so stay somewhere nicer for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: IslanderOz
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews on this hotel I was a bit worried, but my experience was all good and I found the staff from reception, waiters, bar staff to doormen to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself oozes history, the lobby area and the restaurants/burger bar/pool bar were all really nice as was the first floor library bar complete with bowling alley. Food and drinks were really good and as I said before the service from everyone was great. We were upgraded to a king size room and were surprised that room service arrived with a bottle of bubbly and fruit to wish us a happy honeymoon - this was a very nice touch that was much appreciated. The bedroom itself could do with a bit of updating to bring it in line with the rennovated restaurants, but it was adequate for a few days and you don't go to LA to sleep! There is also a variety show/club at the hotel called "Beacher's Madhouse", this was our only bad experience at the hotel but I don't blame management for that - I'd just advise them not to recommend this experience to guests as at $150 a ticket and having to wait for all the freeloaders to get it first I think this is a complete rip off!!! Location was ideal - it's perfect for the metro and buses that get you to Rodeo Drive, Farmers Market, Beverley Centre and the tour buses. Tip - don't get a Shuttle bus to the airport, it took over 2 hours and we were stressing about missing our flight to Australia!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Trendy and almost luxurious...”
Reviews.Author: KLoveToronto
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I really like this hotel. Super-friendly staff, great location, really good food service - both room service and restaurants. And at the price I got through booking dot com I would stay here any time. Only criticism would be that the updated rooms have a bit of a musty feel - like they didn't upgrade the ventilation etc when they did the rest. I stayed in two different rooms and both smelled musty, and the shower in my second room drained a bit out to the room carpet. But otherwise, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all this place has going for it.”
Reviews.Author: Kim J
Reviews.Content: I attempted to enter the hotel at the main entrance to check in but due to some private party I was told I couldn't enter and had to walk around and enter thru a side entrance. Not only was it very late to walk by myself but the side entrance has numerous steps and I have a broken foot. As a paying guest of the hotel shouldn't I be afforded the same consideration as a party goer? The gentlemen at the front desk were very kind and professional. My room on the 4th floor was quite shocking when I walked in. The carpet was spotty and filthy, absolutely no bathroom counter but the worse - a very large ring around the bathtub! The furniture was in dire need of replacement, the shower door did a very poor job of keeping water off the floor, as a matter of fact I needed to call the maid to bring more towels just so I could mop up the floor. Thankfully the bed was clean and comfortable. The party noise could be heard in my 4th floor room and ended promptly at 2 am. Shampoo & conditioner provided, no lotion or shower gel, things that I would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Location is wonderful but at the end of a long day and relaxation is in order, this room doesn't provide it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tiktok85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night.the room was quite large and spacious and well worth it for the price i paid. It's In a great location if you want to see Hollywood. Kodak and chinese theatre are across the road. Staff were ok,not overly friendly .. I guess it's what you can expect from people who probably Don't want to be there and want to be actors instead :) I left my phone charger in the hotel by accident and went to pick it up the next day. I called housekeeping prior and they confirmed it was there over the phone pretty quick so didnt think it was going to be a big deal.... Ended up waiting half hr for it to be retrieved from "storage" .. And the guy at the desk was not that helpful at all. It wasnt a big deal but after waiting for so long they brought out a random iPhone charger. I'm guessing they couldn't find mine. It clearly was not mine as it was an American version And mines Australian... I didn't say anything coz i couldn't be bothered after waiting so I just took it but it's just annoying that they thought they could fool me like that.. Anyways overall it was a great stay, also the burger place downstairs has great burgers :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay here...”
Reviews.Author: loozermama
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. Had a fantastic time. Clean comfortable room w a great view. Friendly front desk staff, helpful concierge. Pricey drinks but it IS LA! Had breakfast in our room each day, delivered hot and fresh. Overall a pretty clean hotel w great views. Close and convenient but don't bring a car! Valet very pricey!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: zphilco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt with my family (children aged 14 and 17) in July 2011. We chose the hotel for its location opposite the Kodak Theatre as we were doing the full "tourist" Hollywood experience, the tackier the better. The hotel exudes history, being the site for the first Oscars ceremony, and had apparently been refurbished recently, although our rooms showed a fair amount of wear and tear. The outdoor pool area was used on two evenings for private parties when we were there - as our rooms were almost directly above the pool, this meant a couple of nights of not being able to get to sleep much before 3am - a better option may have been rooms fronting onto Hollywood Boulevard, although this would probably have been no quieter. (Next time, we will just have to go without the kids and join in all the fun). The large galleried central space on the ground floor is a fantastic spot to sit late at night and watch the beautiful people and wannabes go by, and we ate a couple of times in the main restaurant in the hotel - Public Kitchen - the food was good and the service the best we found in the hotel. The service at the front desk, lobby bar area, valet parking was mixed at best, and was terrible at the pool, leaving the impression that the staff had better things that they would rather be doing. We had recently been at the Bellagio in Las Vegas, so were perhaps feeling a little spoiled, but the Roosevelt's customer services manager should book a few days at the Bellagio to see how it should be done. The Roosevelt is not cheap and not really that suitable for anyone under 21. Would I go back ? Maybe. The sense of history just about outweighs the negatives, but please do something to cheer most of the staff up.

Reviews.Title: “Past glorious days, but still enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Alice_the_wonderland
Reviews.Content: Spend a few days for a fashion shooting at the hotel and staff were very helpful it might be a bit run down, but there are nice rooms, it's the true hollywood feeling. I stayed in the main building and in the garden. I would reco the one in the garden area for the holiday feeling... Everyone is an actor in Los Angeles.. everyone has dreams. The masseur was.. good and.. even handsome.. if i would have been single, i would have proposed him to stay for a glass of wine :)

Reviews.Title: “An exciting Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gwenisgreat
Reviews.Content: We had not been aware there was a "film Week" in progress while we were staying at the hotel. Parts were cordoned off, so didn't see much of the goings on. After seeing price of tea and coffee in our room, decided to bring in soft drinks. Did not have any food in the hotel so can't comment. Our room was furnished with 2 kingsize beds (extremely comfortable), a table a large tv, and advert suggested we watch movies - with only 1 hard dining chair? I did ask for another, preferably comfortable, chair, so another more padded dining chair arrived. It's location was perfect for Hollywood, the Chinese Theatre a stone's throw from the hotel with the Kodak cinema close by. The staff were very polite and helpful. The room was reasonably quiet apart from 1 night when our neighbours decided to have showers 5 a.m. and watch TV? I agree our bathroom was a bit small - but didn't spend too much time in it!

Reviews.Title: “Runned down, bad service and breakfast which is a joke”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Kjeldsen
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be one of the most exiting in Hollywood - but the rooms are runned down. Continental breakfast includes four pieces of burned white bread with butter and nothing else to the price of USD 16. Breakfast room at the ground floor is one of the hotelÂ´s bars and looks like a night club which could be full of women who you pay for certain services in the night. One of the two hotel elevators has been down for three days - nothing happens. Aircon not working good enough in the room - old aircon. Disspointing stay in a hotel with the best location in central Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tatty but an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: boslon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times before so I pretty much knew what to expect. It's a great location if you need to be in Hollywood and you can find a decent rate if you're not there during a major event. However, given the prices, this place is really in need of a facelift. Yes, it has the classic (Historic) Lobby and very cool swimming pool area, but the rooms are dated and the bathrooms are ridiculously small and dark. While I was here one of the two lifts stopped working and the one that remained seemed like it was on life support which caused quite a few delays in getting up and down. One thing to note is the 25 degree restaurant at the Hollywood Blvd entrance. It serves awesome hamburgers and the sweet potato fries are great (and in huge quantity).

Reviews.Title: “Some of this, Some of that!”
Reviews.Author: MrAPayne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is greatly situated if you want to be in the middle of hollywood boulevard, a short walk away from the subway, Chinese theater and many more... However the rooms are the smallest i have stayed in with many years of traveling. Clean & Friendly but you are paying for the location and the heritage of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a mix of up's and downs”
Reviews.Author: freq u
Reviews.Content: Booked for 4 nights and told we were upgraded to a Pool View Cabana room... over looking the pool .. fantastic expect the Audi Sponsored AFI parties each evening... We understand the 'feel' of the hotel and its clients however found the noise frustrating. The hot water worked for the first evening then stayed luke warm. Final evening another party was being set up at our balcony edge and was met with a loverly and very kind and helpful manager from the front desk whom moved us to the 'tower where we enjoyed hot water and a quiet nights sleep. the Valet staff are exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we'd stayed at the previous Hollywood hotel instead of blowing our money here..”
Reviews.Author: Hutcho2033
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Hollywood for our honeymoon about 3 weeks ago. We stayed at a much cheaper hotel just up the road for a few nights then we stayed here, unfortunately. When we arrived, our pleasant enough 20yo front deskess noticed it was our honeymoon. She said "Oh that's wonderful! Hold on, I'll get you some breakfast vouchers for you to use!" We thought that was really nice of them. Eventually, after about 7ish minutes she came back to tell us "I'm sorry, we actually don't have any...." Okaaaay then... Although it wasn't that big of a deal, they need to learn that it really is the little things that matter. It felt that what she really said was "You're really important to us and we want you to come back here......Oh wait, no you're not we don't really care if you do or not.." It would have been great if she had said "I'm sorry, we actually don't have any.... but we'll cover your breakfast at our hotel tomorrow morning." or "sorry but here's a discount voucher to one of the million things to do in Hollywood" To me, it didn't seem it would have been that hard but aparrently it would have been. That's OK we thought. They would have placed a little congratulatory bottle of cheap wine in our room like every other hotel had during our month long honeymoon. Nope, nothing there! Eventually a bottle did come though. The night before we left! A little bit late we felt... Our room was nice enough. It was away from the party rooms around the pool thankfully but we were woken by drunken, disrespectful people traipsing through the hallways in the wee hours on one occassion. Don't touch anything from the mini bar. It all costs twice as much as it does across the road from any number of liquor outlets for the exact same bottle. Also, I had noticed on another very recent review that money was taken from a room. No money was taken from our room (we kept it on us) but I'm very certain I left my 320gig ipod classic next to the bed after we'd left and upon enquiring about it, they said there was nothing found in our room. I can't say I definitely left it there but it was where I used it last. So be careful about your belongings!! After the stay, my wife said the best thing about the hotel was the hot valet parking attendant guy. Is that what Thompson Hotels think make a great stay? Good looking, young people that slightly know they are? They would do well to take a big bite of humple pie and visit that great little hotel up the road called "Magic Castle" and learn a thing or two about customer relations... Perhaps us out of town honeymooners just didn't get the "Hollywood Roosevelt" and we're being a little over critical but we just felt that we weren't that important to them and that left just a little bit of a bitter taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, do not leave any Valubles in your room”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer0_0_0_0
Reviews.Content: I would deter anyone from staying at this hotel since we had money stolen out of our room and security did confirm only hotel staff had entered our room but they would not offer any reimbursements. Also the walls were so thin that we could hear our neighbours partying at 4a not to mention the rooms were very old and shabby. This is not something I would expect from this level of hotel, I have stayed at the Renissance 1 block away and absolutley loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Take it easy Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: LombyF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really average.. Pretty overpriced for what it is. The rooms are teeny tiny and the bathrooms are laughable... You actually can't do your business without smashing your arm into the wall. The reception staff were OK.... A little snobby but still helpful. The room service staff were great. Location is awesome. Basically, I think you could use the money to get a hotel room that is a little bigger and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty wait staff”
Reviews.Author: jen053
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and you can't beat the location. Too bad about some of (but not all) the very snobby wait staff. They were downright rude.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ARF850
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights at 4 star Roosevelt Main entrance rooms very impressive. Hotel rooms poor standard and shabby and dirty. Beds basic frame carpet needs replacing. Charges for everything including coffee/tea in room. Would stay at adjacent Renaissance next time

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood fail, forget it!”
Reviews.Author: hunta2
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for the location which undeniably is the best in town. Right on Hollywood Boulevard, across from the Chinese theatre. That was where the benefits ended. The staff were nice to look at but not overly helpful. There was an event on when we stayed and we were told by valet to park our own car around the back as the front entrance was for the 'event.' We still got charged $33 per day for valet? The room was satisfactory, though small and minimalist. Good view out the window of the star walk and the Hollywood sign. Bathroom tiny and the shower glass was obviously not sealed properly as leaked. The clincher for us was that we were waiting on a hamper from home to arrive for my friend's 30th birthday. Her birthday came and went and when we followed up whether anything had been delivered, we were told 'no'. We followed this up with the people who'd sent the package and they advised that it was delivered the day before my friend's birthday. When my friend went to the front desk to investigate the girl looked surprised and said 'oh it arrived just today, sorry." Err, no! My friend proved it was delivered two days prior but not before the front desk had made her feel like it wasn't their problem and it was just too bad. We did end up getting a $50 room credit for the inconvenience. I wonder if we hadn't of known about the hamper being delivered whether we would have got it at all? Overall, if you want to be treated as a Z-grade celebrity on your holiday, then stay here for sure. If you can get past that, then it does have a certain tinseltown buzz about it and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TDC19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is an old hotel and is probably in need of some more TLC. The hotel had a very musty smell. The rooms were comfortable, no complaints there.
