Our stay in LA was made so much more enjoyable due to the fact that the staff were really nice, & went beyond there call of duty every single day. They booked resturants for us, gave directions, checked our luggage into storage & ordered Taxis & transportation.The Lobby bar is a good place to start of the evening with some refreshments. The pool area is very swanky, & the food from the tropicanna Bar was to our surprise was beautiful. Didn't see any stars our whole time we were in LA, but would Def stay at this hotel again. The Mini Bar is quite expensive, as we found out, after comming back to the hotel & kicking on till the wee hours of the morning. Great location opposite Kodak Theater & Hollywood walk of Fame. Well done to ALL the staff of the Hotel Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Super!...”
Reviews.Author: jules1973Woodridge
Reviews.Content: I took my son on spring break for his great grades and this was our first stop. The hotel was beautiful and the service was wonderful. The front desk was extremely accomodating and even upgraded our room. Great location in Hollywood. Also, the concierge was wonderful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on the last leg of our honeymoon, when we checked in we were given a single room (we may have been on our honeymoon but a single bed really wasn't ideal!), when we complained we were told there were no more rooms... eventually they moved us to a revolting smoke filled room which smelt so awful. The following night we were moved again to a lovely room but this did spoil our trip to LA. Other than that the hotel is lovely and the pool side bar is a very cool place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your binoculars”
Reviews.Author: misslinda00
Reviews.Content: My partner and I desperately wanted to stay in this location, but couldn't quite afford the pricetag. I did my research and got a reasonable deal on Expedia. ($159 p/n) for a Single superior room with double bed. The room was TINY and very basic, however, it did overlook the valet parking and nightclub entrance to the pool area. Take your binoculars and you too might spy Paris Hilton and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beware pool drink prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel for young travellers (I stayed with two friends, all around 25 years old). Good location, fun people. Our room was cute, adequately sized and overlooked the Walk of Fame. We were a bit nervous driving to our hotel, as we passed some questionable neighborhoods and a friend had warned us that the Hollywood area was ghetto. But we were pleasantly surprised to find the strip of Hollywood occuped by the Roosevelt very nice. The pool is nice, nothing extremely special but cute. But drink prices were a bit insane. We paid $75 for a small pitcher of Vodka Lemonad that was way too sweet to even drink. We each had one sip and left the rest. Overall, a great experience. I would definitely go back, but avoid the drinks at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Needs more than a Botox injection”
Reviews.Author: B-ram-z
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for 8 nights. Unbelievable lobby. Restaurant is top-notch. Super hip outdoor bar (if you can get past the velvet ropes - easier on a weeknight). Really did see Paris, Elizabeth Shue, Dr. Phil, Chris Berman, Master P, even Prince. Rooms are updated and trendy - concrete floors in baths (odd half-shower door), a picture above the bed of Bowie/Jagger. An old hotel with an extensive fave-lift, but not much beneath the surface. Good sheets and pillows. Directly across from Chinese theater, cement handprints, etc. Price was dirt cheap for LA, and would have been fun for a night or two, but it became old quickly. Airheaded staff, constant constuction noise, horrible shower pressure on upper floors. Definitely loud partiers on the weekend nights running around and keeping everyone up. Hotel double charged two of my co-workers over $1,500. Snuck our valet parking fees onto multiple rooms for just one car. All was eventually fixed, but the youngsters at the desk can't really solve these problems themselves. If you can't afford first class, this is fun hotel to play Hollywood in. By the way, there are some really great rooms around the pool/Tropicana bar (completely different building) that are straight out of 50's Tinseltown. The Marilyn Monroe suite is a remarkable example of mid-century kitsch/cool. But there would be a lot of noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “OOPS!”
Reviews.Author: jano1932
Reviews.Content: Being a movie buff we picked this particular hotel due to its history and P.R. write-ups. We thought the back entrance a bit odd, but persevered. Service personel were cordial and helpful. We were toured and shown the room where the Academy Awards had been presented. When we got to our room we were not surprised as we had looked at the rooms on the net. It had an upscale decor.As we settled down..to unpack I was shocked to realize that there wasn't a bureau. I called the desk and they were a bit flustered; bell boy sent up; flustered; a few phone calls..my last comment was "did you expect me to hang up my lingerie in the closet?"..when told I could use the closet. When it all settled we were slightly upgraded to a larger room with a bureau..and very accomodating. King bed, nice linens..but, as we settled in we began to notice the "tired" carpet, the chipped paint, the lack of continuity in the decor; the so-so view; the safe that had to be replaced with a new one; the bathroom that looked like it had been constructed from a used construction site...concrete floors that had streaks on them. There really was nothing that was excitable. The location was superior. We put on the happy face and began to explore.The first shock we got was that guests do not have access to Teddy's..the new club. It is advertised and sounds like you can use it..but, the truth is ..it is a private club , with a key..for movie stars to enter and do whatever they please. The pool bar is also excluded on some nights. It almost appears that it is a private playground for the stars. The service elevator was broken and the workmen used the single guest elevator so that getting up and down was dicey. The lobby, front entrance is unappealingly dark. You need a flashlight to see...It hides the gorgeous decor and ceiling. Now, thats the negatives..the dining room was splendid for breakfast. That was the only meal we had there. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Above our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MarriedGG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing. The location is perfect (right on the Walk of Fame across the street from the Chinese Theatre and Kodak Theatre). The staff was excellent. The room was out of a magazine. We were upgraded for free to a room that overlooked the Walk of Fame, both Theatres, the Hollywood sign. Wonderful experience. Totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Close But No Cigar”
Reviews.Author: junoesq
Reviews.Content: If the accomodations were half as lofty as the attitudes, this would be a fine hotel. The main areas, though dark, are suitably dramatic and set a cool tone. The rooms did not meet expectations. My middle aged husband and I were "upgraded" to a poolside cabana by a breathlessly excited reservationista who assured us we could bring two friends to the club that night. Unfortunately, it is not my idea of luxe to be interrogated by a twenty-something trendster armed with a velvet rope and a rubber stamp to get to my room. The room was clean and the linens were high caliber, but the bed itself was soft and lumpy. The rooms are high concept, mid-century inspired moderne but constructed strictly of cinder block, concrete and cold mirrored surfaces. On balance, it seemed like a stylish means of "renovating" an old motel without actually upgrading the infrastructure one iota. Wear and tear is starting to take a toll too. The concrete flooring in the bathroom was noticeably cracked and broken. Endless dark hallways with no elevator and no signage ensured that we roamed lost every time we wanted to leave. It was OK at $159 but would have been an outrage at the aleged standard prices of $500-$600/night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I drove to Hollywood from San Diego and decided to stay the night at the Roosevelt Hotel before our flight home the next day from LA back to Heathrow. We found a great offer on Travelzoo and paid $99 for the kingsize room. When we arrived at the hotel we was greeted by the valet car parking guys who took care of our car and took our cases out of the boot and into the reception area, the car parking charge for the night was $23. We then proceeded to the reception desk and was greeted by a lovely lady who was extremely polite and friendly, she told us that we had been upgraded which we couldnt believe and we had a poolside room all for $99. We was shown to our room by another member of staff who showed us where everything was and if we needed anything who to call etc, and also informed us about the poolside party which would be held later that evening and we could invite 2 friends along who were not staying at the hotel if we wished. The room was fabulous, the decor was second to none, the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was sparkling clean along with the rest of the room, there was a cd player, and flat screen tv, bath robes, hairdryer, phone, mini bar. The prices of the mini bar were quite pricey so we didnt have anything from there and we ate out rather than in the restaurant as we wanted to see some of Hollywood. We had breakfast the next morning in the hotel restaurant which was fantastic the service was excellent and altho a bit pricey $60 with tip for breakfast it was well worth it. The only thing i would complain about is the lighting in the room it was a bit dark altho that it was in line with the decor but the lighting could have been a bit better. The pool was fantastic, and we would definately go back again and wish we had stayed there for a few more days - i would definately reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was kind of freaked out by the complaints on this site, especially since I paid a lot more than I usually do for a hotel since I knew I'd be using the hotel to do a little work and would be spending more time in the hotel than I usually do on vacation. However, within moments of arriving at the Roosevelt, all my fears were wiped away. The staff was friendly and courteous, the room was lovely and clean. I had a fantastic sandwich from room service, I spent the morning lounging poolside with my free paper and later in the day journaled a bit in the quiet and gorgeous front lobby. I was there during the weekend and it was a bit loud, but I didn't expect it to be country-cottage quiet. It's in the heart of Hollywood and there's a club onsite and they had a party in the lobby. I didn't mind it at all, and slept fine, but anyone who would mind it shouldn't stay here, or should bring earplugs. I do agree with other comments that the springs did poke through the mattress and I did mention that to the hotel- and I thought the absence of a top sheet was kind of weird. However all in all- the helpful staff, the nice and relaxing rooms, the gorgeous pool, the historic architecture and the fabulous location made this one of my favorite hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There really is no excuse for such mediocrity, when the Renaissance around the corner offers every luxury for 10 bucks more. The king standard rooms I had were shabby and small, and I can honestly say that something went wrong every night of my stay. The aircon was broken twice, the bathroom flooded several times - both the impractical bath/shower and then the aging plumbing of the toilet. In fact, despite the hygeine issue, staff there did not offer me another room when the toilet was flooding the floor. Other irritations were the lack of mini-bar on floors 3 and 4, the phones which apparently do not always reach a connection downstairs (since everything was going wrong, it would have been nice to be able to report it by phone rather than having to trek down in person every day), and the awful elevators which often take minutes to arrive. I hear that the bar is pretty good, but unfortunately all I saw of it was the poor service and 1930's style rooms and amenities. I hear that the suites are actually renovated to a modern standard. That's great if you have that luxury, but the standard kings are awful - nowhere near the standard of a 2-star chain. My advice - pay the extra 10 bucks and go somewhere good instead.

Reviews.Title: “could be a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kumidog
Reviews.Content: Just came back from long weekend stay at this hotel. First my complaints: 1) Front desk needs better people skills. I had confirmed reservations (with a copy of the email) and they still argued about the rate. When we checked out they tried again to overcharge us. 2) The Valet parking is a joke. They lost our car several times and took FOREVER to get it when they did find it! 3) My friends room had numerous carpet stains and smelled musty. 4) We had to ask for the robes and the towels are way too thin- need to be upgraded. Our room safe never locked consistently. I would guess all of the above are due to inexperienced management. It is the little things that make a stay enjoyable. HOWEVER- the concierge (BEN) was fabulous. He made us several wonderful and hard to get reservations for dinner, put up with us changing the time constantly and was able to get us in to the "Tropicana Bar". He basically saved our trip for us. We ended up spending alot of time out by the pool, enjoying the "private club" atmosphere. I will be sending a letter to the management about the problems we encountered along with a letter to the concierge thanking him. Like I said- This could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: kane020
Reviews.Content: I felt unsafe in this hotel. We were required to go down a dark side street to get back into the hotel because there was a function in the lobby. The corridor to our room felt unsafe as well. We booked a room with 2 beds and got only one. Got a fold out bed and they left it standing against the wall because it wouldn't fit on the floor. Towel bar in the bathroom fell off the wall every time I dried my hands. Room incredibly small and mattress terrible. Service was rude and practically nonexistant. I wanted to leave as soon as I checked in. I've lived all over the world-Far East, Middle East and presently living in Europe. I've travelled extensively and have never seen anything like this place. It's as if they want you to GET OUT.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarriedGG
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Hollywood Roosevelt hotel in early October 2005. We were pleasantly greeted upon arrival and were upgraded to an amazing suite at no extra charge. Brandon at the front desk was delightful and our suite was incredible. We had a great view of the Hollywood sign and we were right on the Walk of Fame and across the street (with views of) the Chinese and Kodak Theatre. This is a first class hotel with excellent service. Their pool and lounge are lovely, though we didn't have any time to spend there (we were busy busy). Excellent location! Excellent service/staff! Would surely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I left early and went to stay at the Hyatt small rooms like a dormitory amenities/facilities not available to guests- outrageous you cannot go in the lobby or restaurants when there are special events which is every night- and the pool is completely off limits to tower guests- the bar has an elite list of names which I was told was impossible to get in if you were a tower guest rude treatment by bouncers/bodyguards keeping you out of lobby

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationfromchgo
Reviews.Content: I travel to Los Angeles once a month and try to stay somewhere different each time. Based on recommendation from a co-worker that lives in L.A., I chose the Roosevelt for this trip. I made my reservation VERY last minute. Then read the reviews here and was very nervous about my stay. But decided to give it a try, and move if necessary. I arrived Sunday September 18 - that's right, Emmy night. A little trouble getting to the place - Hollywood Boulevard closed, parking lot closed until I motioned to the security guard and kindly told him I was checking in. Which he did without question. This was a true test: I arrive in my capris, t-shirt and flip flops, straight off the plane. The hotel is swarming with sequined gowns and tuxedos, humping with the post-emmy party in the lobby. Despite my clearly NON-celebrity status, everyone was VERY friendly - valet, check in staff, bellman. Reviews are true regarding the private parties in the lobby and pool. But I was able to enjoy both areas during my five day stay. And when you're in Hollywood - are you really hanging out at the hotel anyway? And isn't part of the attraction to a Hollywood hotel the chance star sighting? Those are the people in those parties. Room service was probably the best I've ever had: timely and absolutely delicious! I travel extensively and am VERY particular about the hotels I stay in. I have stayed in many "european" style hotels - which is what this is - and find them very comfortable. But, I realize that not everyone is into that, and if you're not, then you indeed won't like the Roosevelt. I believe the hotel is still renovating guest rooms; starting from the top and only down to the 8th floor as of my stay. I think that might explain the sparse furnishings and bare walls. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: LambyHibs
Reviews.Content: We will never stay at this hotel again.......... On arrival, first impressions were really good. The valet and the front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. However, from then on, our stay got worse and worse. On the 1st night there was a private event held in the hotel which went on until 2am and our room on the 4th floor vibrated until that time. We rang to enquire when the music would stop and we were told the hotel had no control over the event. We chose this hotel as an ideal location to end our 3-week stay in California and one of the attractions was the pool. However, the pool was unavailable to guests for 2 out of 4 days of our stay, due again to private events. The hotel bar was also unavailable during our stay. The general impression we got from the hotel is that unless you are attending an event and / or are a celebrity, you are not valued. This is confounded by the fact that we were told that 95% of guests are attending private events. It felt like we couldn't use the facilities that attracted us in the 1st place. To be fair, the front desk staff were understanding and as a result we were compensated with 2 free breakfasts and free parking. By the way, we recommend the chocolate chip french toast!!! If you stay at this hotel and are inconvenienced, we recommend you complain to the front desk and ask to be compensated. This is the 1st time we have ever had cause to complain at a hotel, so this illustrates the frustration we endured on what should have been a perfect end to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not put credence in some of these postings, this hotel is fantastic! You will not be dissapointed. I almost canceled because of some of the negative reviews. They were written by folks who did not stay there or have some sort of vendetta. Staff, rooms, public areas, restaurant/bar, pool and location were all above par. Enjoy your stay. I am going back next month.

Reviews.Title: “Big big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge_Family
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and hungry after a long delayed flight at 6.30pm to find that our room that was supposed to be ready at 3.30pm wasnt ready even though they had an extra 3 hours to prepare! We then had to spend an hour in the lobby getting tired and emotional awaiting our room which when we got in was unclean, small, with a noisy aircon and lacking sufficient towels, pillows, coffee mugs for 2 occupants (let alone a family of 4). Getting housekeeping or front desk to answer the phone was so impossible I had to go down to the lobby again, join the queue..... When we went to the pool the following morning we were told that as we were in a Tower room only 3 of us could go in. I complained loudly, were a family of 4 for pity's sake, and I kept it up for a long time and eventually we got in but the front desk staff were v. rude. At the pool, it was a bit noisy but the kids loved it until thy stopped doing lunches in a blatent attempt to get you to take their over-priced bbq burger option. Oh, and the Valet Parking left me with a dented fender on my hire car. the onyl good thing about this place was the breakfast where the service and food was excellent - just over-priced. This is not a family friendly hotel and its exceedingly overpriced. If you have kids THEN go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “What the hell?”
Reviews.Author: titanik
Reviews.Content: Don't expect customer service or even manners at the Roosevelt. There's a new "scene" at the pool/bar. Sure, there may be some celebrities but you won't see them - hotel guests are not allowed in. I found out that the hotel pool is usually closed to guests because of private parties or the exclusive bar. They're not even nice about it. We were treated as if we were a bother and told to move on. The rooms weren't even that nice. I checked out early and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed in this hotel for one night to enjoy a nice hotel one day while on vacation. when we checked in we were told they could not find our reservation and were left standing in the lobby for almost an hour. we were treated very cold as though it was our fault, and when finally given a room, we had to ask for directions to the room (once again treated like dirt) and no one offered to help with our bags..they were to busy helping the nicer dressed guest. our superior king room was the smallest hotel room i have ever stayed in, and the bathroom was even smaller. we were kept up all night because of the paper thin walls, we could here everyone else staying on our floor. our city veiw (which was extra) was the back side of the hotel's sign. the pool which we were told is open till 10pm really closes at 7pm and becomes a private club that even the hotel guest can't use. when leaving it took the valet 35 mins. to find our car which when then had to walk to even though everyone elses was brought right to the door, and once again were not helped with the bags...the guy didn't even hand us our keys they were left for us in the car!!! we were also charged for things from the minibar that we never touched!!! this was a horrible waste of our money, we were treated much much nicer the next night down the road at a much cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: jkeyser
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights, in order to attend a convention in downtown LA, as I did about a year ago. On the positive side, the hotel had a nice location close to the Chinese theater and Hollywood/Highland (the one somewhat nice area of Hollywood Blvd.). Getting to the metro station was very easy. I didn't have any real problems while there. Unlike others, I actually found the staff to be quite friendly, but I never had any problems. I felt like this hotel was trying to be "trendy" and "chic", but it just made some things wierd. As another person mentioned, there are no sheets on the bed - just a comforter. I assume (hope!) they change the comforter cover, but it still seemed wierd. The soaps and shampoos were all some sort of herbal something or other - fine but wierd. Furniture was fine, but a bit worn. I understand they've had a recent renovation, but I sure couldn't tell. I didn't eat at the hotel, but there was a good Gelati shop right nearby, and a good Thai restaurant a short walk the other direction. On the negative side, parking was expensive ($23/day - it went up $5 in the past year!). You have to pay separately for each computer you want internet access on. Hollywood Blvd. overall is not a particularly nice place (though the immediate region of this hotel is OK). Overall, I thought it was an OK place, but it's nothing luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “poor service and terrible attitide”
Reviews.Author: SFsister
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night only ... a saturday night. When called on Saturday am after arriving in LA to check about an early check in they said the reservation was cancelled. I had not cancelled the reservation and they could not tell me who at the hotel had cancelled the reservation or what day it was cancelled. Fixed the sitation only to receive a chilly welcome at the front desk. The service was snooty and room service was not even picking up the phone even though there was a late night room service menu in the room. After trying for 15 minutes to get someone at the front desk or room service to PU we gave up. As mentioned by others who have reviewed you can not go to the pool area past 7pm as it is closed and is a private club. Even hotel guests can not get into the bar/club. Went to the pool on Sunday but once again very pretentious and over rated. Our Jr. Suite was roomy but was not overly impressed with the ammenities. Not recommended and definately not a child friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you don't expect sheets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel, the smell was stagnit. Their were painters in the lobby and the entire hall permeated a strong paint smell. Once checked into the room, the furnishings were very old, the switchplates were hanging on to electrical cords barely preventing them from touching the ground. Pulling back the bedspread which had unidentifable stains present, there were no sheets, and no blankets on the bed. The mattress could be seen through the paper thin fitted sheet. As you begin to lie on it the electrical tape holding the mattress together snapped and popped and I began to fall into a hole in the middle of the mattress. As I had received a room with two beds, I tried the other bed. As I pulled back the bedspread, their was again no sheets, no blankets, and what appeared to be urine stains on the mattress. Needless to say, I packed back up and looked for another Hotel. I was truely disappointed as I had heard this was a fine hotel. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Hollywood, a strange stay.....”
Reviews.Author: flasugmag
Reviews.Content: This was a strange, but satisfying, stay from start to finish. The front desk people were very nice but explained that the pool would close at 3pm for a private event. It was about 1:30pm, I do understand that check in time was not until 3pm, so we were early. We quickly changed into swim suits, and rushed down, we really wanted to go in this historic pool! As we arrived, we were told the pool was closed. We asked really nicely if we could just briefly check it out. There were people setting up for the event who were obviously kind of mad at the sight of tourists with kids arriving and trying to swim. We did take a quick dip, but were pretty much glared out. Oh well, we did get a brief look. We were mildly dissapointed that our room did not face the famous Hollywood Blvd, but that feeling went away quickly as we watched some sort of red carpet being rolled out in the valet parking area below us. We joked that we might see "stars" ! We went about our day enjoying the area and all its wierdness. The hotel was a SUPER spot to be based to see all the action. The stores, the food, the famous sites, the new complex across the street, etc. This hotel is totally Hollywood. The elegance of the lobby, the ballrooms (you can peek in), the lounge, even the pool area, were fabulous. When we returned to the hotel, tired and a little overwhelmed, we discovered that there really WAS a red carpet affair going on in the pool area and there were in fact stars present. We actually got to take pictures from our room of people arriving. This was way cool, need I say more. My husband and I took turns going downstairs and standing with the real photographers. We never saw anyone except some dude I later learned was Magic Don Juan. (?) A lady in the restroom who was obviously leaving the party told me it was a party hosted by E! for Hugh Heffner and his lady friends. Wow. Overall, this night was pretty unforgetable.The next day, the lobby was closed because they were filming something! The hotel room was very modernly funished, low beds, a sitting couch, a nice desk, a big closet. I paid $189 for a room with two double beds. Yeah it was a little small, but this is an old hotel. It has been uniquely redone. A doorman told us they are striving to get away from the touristy crowd and recapture the "hotel of the stars" status. The lobby was unsurpassed in its elegance and overall ambiance, sort of dark and gloomy, but upscale like a castle. Cleanliness was great, bathroom was nice and even had great shampoo and conditioner! We were travelling with kids, and this hotel wasn't exactly very kid friendly, but that was OK with us. The service was OK, kind of snotty but this is Hollywood. I would stay again, hopefully without the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: ECTB
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I visited the Hotel Roosevelt on July 29-31, we found out that the hotel had no rooms left (they overbooked). After an hour, they shipped us 8 miles to Glendale. Despite the fact we made reservations and reserved a room in the newly remodeled area, we were once again disappointed. When I demanded an upgrade, it took awhile for them to grant my wish, only to find out the upgrade was only two floors up. When speaking with the manager, I was told the first night (which we did not spend there) was free as well as the hotel we spent the night at was free. Surprise, surprise, when we checked out, they said we were charged for all three nights. I asked for a refund, but according to them, since we booked with a travel website and not directly through them, we were not going to get a refund. The rooms are okay, but definitely need to be remodeled. There was stains on the carpet in both the rooms we were in. All-in-all, the hotel has a prime location to Hollywood, but I think this is easily the WORST experience and treatment I have ever received. The whole scenario definitely could have been handled differently and I would have been okay with it; but it really felt that if you were one of their A-list celebrities, they would do anything for you; but if you are an average Joe, don't bother us. I would highly recommend NOT visiting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: barb600
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel in May. Picked it for location and a really good rate for the week. I agree that it was incredibly noisy--heard every sound from next door through the very thin walls. Maybe I am naive, but I was furious that they charged me for using the coffee pot in the room each morning, not to mention that it was next to impossible to get someone to leave creamer and suger each day. Housekeeping never seemed to have any on hand, and the front desk was indifferent to my requests. I travel to LA often, and I will not stay there again. Sure, the location is great for tourists, but I think one can do better.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and charming and classic. The rooms itself were beautifully furnished, especially the ground floor suites with the cabanas. Other than that, my experience with the Roosevelt Hotel was poor. The staff did not seem to care that we spent money to stay at their hotel. Clearly, whoever was famous or "somebody" trumped all guests. Service is very important to me, especially from a hotel. All we encountered was an unhelpful, inept, unwilling, and infuriatingly, unapologetic staff. It took almost half an hour to check in because there was only one person at the front desk, in a very loud lobby. Friday evenings are a nightmare at this hotel. Check-in means averting the throngs of Hollywood scenesters and starlets who are clamoring to get in to Tropicana. Paying hotel guests, however, have no access whatsoever to the pool that they so lovingly advertised online. I left feeling disappointed and even worse, robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Listened!”
Reviews.Author: tjh17
Reviews.Content: In booking this hotel I read previous reviews but thought, "everyone has their own opinion" so I decided to go ahead and form my own.......Well, I should have listened! The check in was very unorganized as they were short staffed (by their own admission) and the room we were given did not look like the photos. Our bed was awful with springs poking us in the back all night long. Towles were a bit shabby as well. The next day I asked to be moved to a larger room, which they did, and this room was slightly better. Mattress was still hard and in need of replacement but towels were nicer. The bathroom has been renovated and the shower now has a half glass door, which caused water to leak all over when showering. The walls are paper thin and we had to call security one night as we could hear everything going on in the next room, including a fight. The hotel itself has been renovated but the new owners do not allow pictures to be taken.......what a shame that a Hollywood landmark with so much history does not allow its guests to take pictures to remember their stay. I found this very disappointing. The pool closes every night at 7 for "private" parties, once again alienating the paying guests. If the new management spent more time trying to make their guests happy and less time trying to be the next "in place to be" more people would write better reviews and therefore recommend this hotel. Party places come and go but good customer relations go along way. The best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “too much hype - VIP access only”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: had high expectations for this hotel, travel to LA about 12-15 times a year so, with all the recent hype, I thought maybe this beautiful landmark would replace my usual West Hollywood spot, but when I had people over, I was told that hotel guests were not aloud to use the bar (apparently it is closed every night private parties â€“ you are not even able to go outside and enjoy sitting by the pool in the evening) and was instructed to go down to the hotel down the street and use their bar. My immediate response was â€˜why didnâ€™t I just stay there then?â€™ the rest of my experience was nice enough but definitely didnâ€™t meet up to the level of any number of other hotels in the area â€“ (they donâ€™t even have a website).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! My girlfriends and I spent the weekend in Hollywood and made reservations at this hotel. While pulling up in our car, the valet staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel lobby staff was just as courteous. While checking in, I had requested a room with a patio. Unfortunately, they couldn't accomodate our request, but said they can give us a 'cabana' room on the ground level (no change in price). They advised that it could get a bit loud at night due to the festivities that take place in the pool area in the evening. We agreed to this room and off we went in search for our reserved room. As soon as we opened the door, we were amazed at how awesome the room was! The only bad thing was there was only 1 king size bed for 4 of us girls. However, I was in awe with the room decor. The bathroom was so awesome and chic! We had a ground level patio with a lounge chair and table. Our cute bell boy brought our luggages from the valet area and updated us on the nights events. We were very excited to hear that since we have a 'cabana' room that we are entitled in and out privelages of the pool festivities. While everyone waits in line to get in where the party's at, we just had to flash our room key and confirm our room number and reservation name. The hotel restaurant was delicious and we were honored to have the wonderful service. We didn't have reservations, but they easily accomodated us after a 15 minute wait. The hostess and wait staff were very courteous and fun. After dinner we went to the pool festivities (didn't have to wait in the huge line) where we encountered Kimberly Stewart and Hank Azaria. The pool festivities were hopping and the drinks were great! Great place for anyone who wants to have fun and possibly hook up. At the end of the festivities, we went back to our awesome room. I would've had a good night sleep had it not been for the people walking and talking throughout the hallways during the early morning hours. After a few hours of tossing and turning (5:30 AM), we finally called the front desk to get the noise level toned down in the hallways. The walls must be really thin because 5 minutes after the call, I heard security asking the folks in the hallway to keep it down. The bed was the most comfortable I've slept in a looooong time! The only crappy thing is I am now ridding my ankles and lower shins of the bruises I obtained from the platform bed. My bad, I just kept accidently banging my legs on it everytime I passed by the bed (forgetting it was platform). All in all, this is a wonderful hotel and definitely a great place for the folks who like to party! I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Cabana room/ Party 'til ya drop (if your under 30)”
Reviews.Author: kasialouise
Reviews.Content: We had a Cabana room with balcony overlooking the pool on a Saturday... great decor with concrete counter tops in the bathroom. Platform bed and glass desk with flat tv. One wall was entirely dark mirror so room seemed larger but it was not garish. Check-in is at the "back of the hotel", not in the grand former lobby. We checked in at noon. There were several unorganized lines...people checking out and in. Not enough staff. Pool in the afternoon and at night is bascally off limits (bouncers at entry) unless you are hip and under 30 or you make the "list" of cabana room guests. Party wth dj and bar until 2 am. The hotel is within walking distance of the Hollywood Bowl. Fun neighborhood..lot's going on..hot dog stands on the street at night, musicians, rappers, tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt: Hooker Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt over New Year's Weekend in '04. We were impressed with the decor and location, very convenient, but not impressed with check in service. Room service wasn't too bad. Room was great. However, we went to dinner New Year's Eve and when leaving found the hotel filled to brimming and more in the parking lot; a NY's Eve party was evidently being held in the hotel. The numbers of people indicated more "bash" than "party." We returned after midnight and the hotel was overflowing with people. Many of them quite honestly looked like hookers or call girls, some were obviously transvestites, many with multiple men on their arms and overcrowding elevators to the upper floors with their "partners." We could not get to our room. We tried in vain to find stair wells. After wandering through crowds of people and smoke, we finally were able to cram into an upward-bound elevator and managed to get to our room. The noise continued even on the 10th floor til well past 5:00 a.m. I was appalled to see that there was virtually no hotel security, anyone could wander in off the street and apparently did, and appalled that they allowed this sort of activity to go on so openly. What really got me though was seeing a family with young children in the same dilemma, trying to get up to their rooms. I can only imagine what the children must have thought. I wrote the hotel an email about our experience, hoping at least for an apology. We got no response at all; we never have. My family and I will never stay there again under any circumstances. If they continue to treat us and people like the Bermans in this way, when the celebrity train has passed them by, and it will, they will find themselves with no customer base.

Reviews.Title: “Wear a hard hat!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location. I stayed there 06/29/05. A careless cleaning lady dropped a long pole she was cleaning windows with and it hit me on the head. She did not apologize - just looked scared and picked it up. When I tried to speak to the manager about it he refused to talk to me. An icy front desk person referred me to the security person on duty. Not even an apology from anyone! Very disappointing! The hotel is clean - not fancy. Beds are comfortable. Couldn't find the ice machines where the info in the room said they would be. No pop machines. Neighborhood scary at night. Parking charge is high. Although the nicest employee was the one that parked my car. Not sure I would spend my hard earned money here again.

Reviews.Title: “dont be put off by grumpy guests! wonderfull place wonderfull history”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly ill be honset my girlfriend and i were travelling around america and mainly staying in hostels, but this gas not put bias on my opinion of thsi hotel. from the moment we booked it, (at a good rate on expedia) till we left we would (unlike many other reviewers) have no pety complaints about anything. yes we got upgraded we think because there was a movie magazine awards so as not to be disturbed by noise, so that quashes the main bad review going around of staff not doing anything about the noise. the room was lovely, and still kept a sense of history and class , which if you have read the other reviews is what the hotel has with it holding the ist oscars. the hotel has not lost this sense of sophistication at all. (take note of this when you read other reviews) as for the guy complaining about it being on the route of l.a tours surly that says somthing positive about the place. nicolas cage had a party hear a week before we stayed!!!!!!cant be that bad really!!staff very friendly and helpfull, even tho we were two young travellers and to be honest didnt have a choice but to dress like it! decor very nice, not a bad word to say about it. it is typical that people will find somthing to moan about but if you look at what they moan about it is all personell and ther is nothing here that will do anything but make your stay in l.a more enjoyable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old world charm”
Reviews.Author: australiantraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Australia about 10.30am & as we had pre-booked our room so that we could catch up on some sleep we were shown into our rooms immediately. We found the rooms very comfortable, well laid out & very clean. The staff were very helpful & courteous. We really enjoyed our stay. We liked the location because it was close to everything that we needed to do. Olive & Jack Fairclough, Queensland, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great Loction but Hotel was not so great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great! It was within walking distance to some really great resteraunts and other Hollywood sites. The hotel lobby was nice, but really dark. We were in meetings all day and wanted to see the pool. They closed the pool at 7:00 p.m. every night and then had "Private Parties" every night. We were there for an entire week and never got to see the pool. Our convention sponsors should have just told us that there was no pool available. Our room was more like a closet. It was EXTREEMLY small. We did not even have a chair. One could barely move in the shower. I asked to be moved to a non-smoking room but was told that they could not do that because the hotel was full. I think that the thing that freaked me out the most was that there were no sheets on the bed. I was told that this was a "European" trendy thing. I thought it sucked. I got the clear impression that Hotel Guests were considered second class citizens and that you were only treated well there if you were "someone important or trendy." I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a room and were confirmed a room with 2 beds, one for our 13yr old daughter and one for us. When we arrived we were told that the hotel was filled to capacity. The room we were given was one bed only. When I complained I was told that there was nothing they could do - and gave us a roll in bed! We then went to have dinner at the restaurant after dressing only to be told that hotel guests do not have any preference and they were already fully reserved. When I asked for directions to any other nice places to eat the hotel staff were unable to help me. After finding a place to eat some blocks away, we returned to the hotel to sleep and were unable to settle due to the noise from the pool area. The hotel finally turned the music off after 1am. When I complained the next morning to the manager I was told that there was nothing that they could do to address any of my concerns or complaints. They did not seem to be concerned when I told them that I would not recommend the hotel to any-one.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be seen in many movies. Well, it is located in front of Mann's Chinese Theatre, which also features in many Hollywood movies. It is located very centrally, meaning that you can do a lot by just walking there. So you can see the Hollywood stars, you can view the handprints at Mann's Chinese Theatre. And basically you can visit loads of cheap shops that sell t-shirts and map that feature where the stars live. From the hotel start loads of tours (even bringing you to Mann's chinese theatre, just 10 seconds walking from the Lobby... wow... what a tour!). So you can visit Universal Studios, do a trip of Los Angeles, see the Chimneys of the houses of the stars. As far as location: it is a good hotel. Even though most of the street seems to be glitter and glamour from past days and it seems gone. If you have any expectations of getting a Hollywood-feeling... it tends to dissapoint. All the images you already know from tv and the movies, and in real they tend to be dissapointing. The hotel itself is old (when we were there), and is in need of a make-over. We visited this hotel as part of a tour, so I do not know exactly what we paid for this stay. But the rooms were simple, and you always got the feeling that this hotel was something special years ago, but not anymore. Like visiting the hotel 50-80 years too late. Basically a dissapointing hotel, but nice to see it in many movies...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms but service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Saffy2
Reviews.Content: The desk staff were totally unhelpful in this hotel, it took the reception girl almost 15mins just to check us in. When we asked about public transport we were told to just take cabs and no one could offer any advice about how far it is to walk to certain locations etc... On our day of departure we asked for a cab to be booked we went into the lobby and found it hadn't been booked at all and we almost missed our train as a consequence. The restaurant was quite nice despite being a little expensive but the rooms were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here and would not stay again, There is insufficient sound proofing for both internal and external noise. It is in the heart of Hollywood and noise is to be expected however staff do not seem to prevent or control local noise. We had a noisy motorbike revving its engine at 3.00am in the valet parking area. The hotel is also dark and gloomy. There also appeared to be insuffient security as we were confronted by a lift full of drunken teenagers who were not residents but wanted access to the penthouse. Would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Roosevelt hotel was pretty good. I thought the rooms were sound proof (mine overlooked the carpark) and the staff were very friendly and professional. This hotel is a huge old but renovated place with heaps of style from Charlie Chaplain days. It took me a while to undertand the lay out of the hotel but once that was out of the way it was great. The pool area was so kitch with an art deco feel. really cool. I had the junior suite which was plenty of space for one person. The daily morning delivery of papers was great and the bathroom was groovy. The only problem was the toilet blocked but as I later found alot of toilets block in the USA. I would definatley stay there again. I loved it. It wasnt the best best best hotel in the world but for the price ($100) per night and the fab location it was well worth it. Just make sure your shuttle drops you off around the back of the hotel not on Hollywood Blvd. The back is actually where the front entrance is. Your first impressions will benifit if you do that.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsaK83
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in this nice hotel. The rooms we stayed in were completely new, modern and the bathroom was very nice as well. There was a CD player in the room with a complimentary CD (mix of Lounge Music), which was a nice plus. I read the other reviews and expected much worse. The restaurant in the hotel serves excellent food and the breakfast ist excellent as well. If you're looking for a hotel in the Hollywood area, I would definintely recommend this one, because it's just a 5 min drive away from the nice restaurants on Sunset Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, good location, nice”
Reviews.Author: ELD492
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 days in May 05 and it was great. The pool area is not currently under construction. The lobby is huge and dark and a great place to hang out and have drinks. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. It was good to be right in the middle of everything. Sure, the area is filled with tourists but it's a fairly central place to take a cab to anything else if you need to. The walls are very thin but that didn't bother us. (Unfortunately, we were not haunted by Montgomery Clift as is rumored to happen.) The only bad thing was the mini-bar fridge is so small, you can't keep any of your own stuff in there, and you have to pay for wireless connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “cavernous and old-world”
Reviews.Author: politicsdc
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel, but it never felt particularly comfortable to me. It has a bit of a gloomy, cavernous atmosphere -- an old but renovated hotel that has a well-furnished but dim lobby, long hallways, and a lot of meeting and retail space that seems to be unused. The staff seemed pretty erratic and the place lacks adequate signage. Getting my luggage brought up by the bell staff was unnecessarily difficult and I ended up getting the bags for myself. There is a very nice outdoor pool surrounded by a courtyard, adjacent to the hotel. I also spent a while looking for a phantom fitness room that turned out to be closed, but none of the hotel's materials included that key fact. Overal, this is not a place with a tremendous amount of warmth, even though it has a good location in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as promised”
Reviews.Author: jalapenojuice
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite in a Junior Suite on the 9th floor. I've stayed numerous times at the Rennaissance down the way and wanted to give this place a try. The hotel location is great. The room was spacious and the decor was chic. Lots of extras. Very clean. However, the room is not well insulated and you can hear your neighbors quite well along with the Hollywood Boulevard traffic that runs all night (people yelling and taxi cabs honking away). The airconditioning/heating/furnace appliances are extremely loud and go off and on even when the units are turned off. We had unplugged the refrigerator thinking that was the noise. In the junior suite the bathroom is enlongated with a shower stall at the very end, a tub in front of that and then the toilet next to the door. The layout was odd and getting into and out of the shower was awkward. Poor lighting in the bathroom. Not a restful stay. Rennaissance way better.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: dat1123
Reviews.Content: We were concerned with the location of this hotel, but immediately upon arrival our concerns went by the wayside. This is a grand old hotel with a touch of class. When we pulled into the parking area located behind the hotel our car doors were opened for us by staff and we were greeted like royalty. Check in went very smoothly by friendly staff. Bellman were courteous and prompt with our luggage. The rooms were awesomely decorated although a little on the small size much like most of the hotel rooms in NYC The rooms were very, very clean. The "open shower" effect (only one clear frameless door on the tub) created water puddles in the bathroom after each use but we discovered it was just a matter getting used to it which resulted in the least amount of flooding. The rooms were extremley quiet and soundproof. The staff seemed very professional and friendly. Overall for the price, it was well worth the stay. The hotel is centrally located to most tourist attractions in the LA area and definitely a place we would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As per other reviews - we unfortunately were in the middle of playboy-golf convention. (Middle aged men thinking they have something to scantily dressed ladies). Had the 5th floor overlooking the pool and it was really really noisy as playboy was having a night pool-casino party. Called front desk to ask for music to be turned down, but it never was actioned. Couldn't sleep until 3am. Even the police were called! Poor neighbours and poor hotel guests! Clearly management have no control over what happens at these conventions. Night manager promised to address in the morning. Come daytime, day manager (Alex) wouldn't do a refund as we had booked through Expedia even though she said whe would "like to" help. Asked for her business card, but didn't have one. She promised to write an email to confirm she was happy for Expedia to do a refund but never did it. Very Disappointing. Other desk staff very professional and courteous but forget a good night sleep in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: MKeebler
Reviews.Content: Good location if you don't have a car & want to see Hollywood. Parking is $18/day plus tip for the valet. The rooms are small. Very clean. Had a great CD player. View of Chinese theater from our room. Request a room in the remodeled tower.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10-12 March 2005 and we had the best time. We had a room on the 4th floor and the rooms were above my expectations. We had 2 queen beds which my husband and I loved and the beds had doona's which we had so missed and we had the best sleep here. The rooms are not soundproof as upstairs a guy had his tv on all night and we could here it. The location can't be beat, right in the heart of things. There was a playboy party on the night we arrived which was a bit annoying(not for my husband) lots of people around everywhere and some areas of the hotel we were not allowed to go. The lifts are SO SLOW and I could not seem to find the stairwell to walk. I would stay here again as across the street was the subway for Universal which is only one stop away.

Reviews.Title: “Eavesdropper's ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Synchronicity
Reviews.Content: If you like listening to other people's private conversations, this hotel will suit you. I have never stayed in a hotel with such thin walls! We could hear every word from the rooms on both sides even at normal conversational level and, as a result, spent our whole time whispering so that we could not be overheard. The hotel has supposedly just had a major refurbishment, but I thought our room was quite shabby and very basic despite the fact it was described a a 'Kingsize Superior Room'. The carpet was stained, the walls were marked, and the furniture dark and square. We stayed in 13 hotels in 5 countries on this trip and the Hollywood Roosevelt would only rate about number 11 on our list.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed two nights March 19th weekend and were impressed with the renavations. I'd pick a vintage property with a sense of place over a blaw modern hotel any day, although last year we stayed at the near by Renaissance and enjoyed that also. The room was large, I think they may have been two rooms at one time. The pool was up and running but with the rain keeping things cool so no one was using it. The pool area looks 50/60's retro sheik. I'd like to go back in the summer because it looks like it would have a great party vibe. The check in staff was friendly and professional. Later we asked help with directions and the woman made a call to verify the hours and details of the museum exhibit we were going to. We walked around the area checking the names of the stars. It was cool to be in middle of fame. I travel to the LA area about twice a year and would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyC
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of five people in two rooms at the Roosevelt in December of 2004. The complex was obviously being renovated at the time to take the hotel back to its glory days when it was made famous for hosting the Academy Awards. Our rooms were both quite nice, however they were tight on space and the facilities were average considering the star rating of the hotel. There was a restaurant being built while we were there, but this meant that we were treated to below standard services in the majority of the hotel. I would check to see whether the renovations were finished if I were to stay there again. The good thing about the hotel was its location. Right outside Mann's Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre there are heaps of tourist attractions right at your doorstep. In addition to this the bus stop is directly opposite the hotel and it is easy to get to most places in LA from that spot. I would also recommend not booking any tours before you leave Australia if you are travelling to Hollywood. Across the road from the Roosevelt there are heaps of different tour companies that offer great tours for discounted prices. There is also a good tourist information booth in the Kodak Theatre Complex and the people there can help you with loads of information and phone numbers for companies. The location makes up for a lot of the short coming in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: topcat72
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed in the roosevelt in LA as part of our honeymoon in january 2005. we both loved it, in terms of architecture, design, ambience, friendliness of staff and location, it scored on all fronts. we were given a free upgade on arrival, and had our meal that night at the quiet restaurant on the ground floor ( it was midweek in january, hence the quietness) Staff excellent, both at desk, lobby, and bar. Good modern bedrooms , with sound system, excellent bathroom products, quiet recessed lighting, ample storage space, plus walk out the door and you're facing the chinese theatre. any other negative reviews here have no idea what they are on about! did these people stay in the same hotel? stay here, it;s great and if you love cool design and a sense of history, it's made for you!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights in late January 2005.We were a bit worried by the user reviews but they had a really good rate of $150 AU per night and we wanted to stay in Hollywood, because of the location and proximity to the Metro train. We were not disappointed. The room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. We had a nice view over the city through big windows. The room was on the small side and the beds only double and a bit firm but we didn't find this a problem, and we are a family of 4! Found the staff at reception very helpful when questioned about local transport and activities. Housekeeping was prompt and polite when we called for more towels. Bell staff were happy to look after our luggage on the last day and arrange cabs promptly. The old foyer was lovely. We were warned several times on booking that the pool was still being renovated so that was entirely expected. The evenings were a bit cold to swim anyway. Had a look at the pool area and it should be very nice when completed. Found the Metro easy to use and the station is across the road ( but remember the machines with only accept NEW $1 bills for tickets!-as the tourist office told us after we had battled with it for 1/2 an hour). It is a very quick and cheap way to get to Universal Studios and Downtown LA. Also connects to Long Beach but trip is about 1 1/2 hours. The Hollywood area itself was interesting and we enjoyed the new shopping and restaurant complex. I would be happy to stay in this hotel again as a good value , mid range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Los Angeles (on our way back from Hawaii) and stayed for 2 nights at The Roosevelt Hotel. Having (rather stupidly I now think) read the reviews before we went, we were a little worried I have to say. However, all our fears were unfounded and we found the Roosevelt to be a visit of pure luxury. We had a wonderful room, the decor of the entire hotel we loved and every single member of staff we came into contact with spoke perfect English and were extremely helpful. In fact we didn't recognise the hotel from the description in some of the reviews we had read! We couldn't fault it - it met our every need. They did have some events going on whilst we were there. Some we weren't even aware of and the one we were aware of in no way spoilt our visit and the staff certainly didn't make us second class guests because of it. After all, I imagine most businesses have to diversify to make a profit these days and the fact that they are a popular venue for events surely means their customer care and professionalism is good! We would make a point of staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Qld Girl
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home to Australia from a very successful trip to the US. Whilst in Los Angeles we stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt where we found the service faultless and the staff only too willing to assist us in any way. As we were leaving at midnight for our return flight to Australia the hotel stored our luggage for the day and not only organised a private car to collect us for transportation to the airport but also maintained phone contact with the car to ensure its timely arrival. (The traffic was horrific due to road closures in preparation for the Academy Awards.) We would definitely stay at the Roosevelt again - a truly delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a one-night stay at the Roosevelt on Sat. Nov. 20, 2004. We had driven out with some friends earlier that year and were interested in all the paranormal things we had heard and read about. We were also breathtaken with everything it had to offer, thus making us want to return to stay. So I looked online to see what their rates were, but I called to make the reservation. I booked a junior suite for one night at the price of $189, plus an $18 valet fee, but with unlimited in-and-out privileges. The valet shouldn't really be that much because the valet staff was average. The check-in staff was very polite. We were given a beautiful, large room, with a view of Hollywood Blvd. that we didn't even ask for! We were so excited! The room had a very modern CD player, a big swiveling TV, a couch, coffee table and chair, a dresser w/ a minibar.. a big beautiful COMFY bed with plush soft linen. The bathroom was awesome. It had an old-time Hollywood feel to it, and it included an amazing shower and a separate bathtub. Now i read a lot of the reviews and everyone's complaining about how the pool wasn't available because of renovations. If you're really going to be that intent on using the pool and/or jacuzzi (like me and my b/f were), find out! All i had to do was go online and click on the pool and it said it was going to be closed. I didn't freak out because I WENT PREPARED. However, the staff did inform me that they had a deal going with the hotel across the street (i think it's called renaissance, not sure) that the roosevelt guests could use their pool. Well, before attempting to walk over in our bathing suits, we took a stroll to inspect it. It was an extremely long walk through very public places where we did not want to walk in our bathing suits, wet or dry. And when we got to that hotel, we asked the front desk if they had a jacuzzi and the woman looked at us as if we were extreme idiots and huffily replied no. She made a horrible impression on us. thank god we weren't staying there. So, yes, we were disappointed about not having the pool, BUT we were prepared. Never assume anything, because obviously it leads to disgruntled people and disappointment. But it can be easily remedied by just asking the question "is the pool open?" One more thing that I should mention. I also read in a lot of reviews about how the staff cares more about any functions that may be going on in the hotel rather than their own guests. I disagree with that but I had a similar issue. My boyfriend and went to take the stairs up to the main entrance that leads you to Hollywood Blvd. There were no signs or anything saying that something was going on. There did happen to be a wedding and they were in one section of the room that wasn't in the way of the exit. But someone working the party(?) ran over and immediately stopped us and said "sorry you can't go through here!" He got right up in our personal space and was very rude about it. We were innocent..we didn't know. So, if they're going to have any sort of event...especially where this wedding was, make a sign. Other than that, we absolutely can't wait to return to the hotel...when we have money..because yes, it is expensive, but it's a wonderful experience. I also have a review about the Excalibur hotel in las vegas for any interested parties.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt several years with groups. We've noticed that the hotel, due to the changing economic climate has changed its' focus to special events and large events which pay the bills! Don't go near the place on New Year's! You'll feel like an unwelcomed guest, not sleep all night and have no hot water to shower in the morning! Still in renovation the lobby remains stark with little or few relaxing amenities. The hotel restaurant's service and food remains excellent. The restaurant staff is very pleasant and efficient! Check the airport hotels which offer a more modern setting and much better prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the worst reviews...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt for business. There are some problems, but I think many of these are attributable to the fact that the hotel is old, and in an area that is only now receiving some attention for revival. It takes a little imagination to see the Golden Era of the though the hotel has been recently refurbished. For whatever reason, they don't use the front entrance as the main entrance anymore, which is a shame because your first impression is of a cramped den-like area, rather than the rather grand lobby where you can picture the way the hotel was "back in the day." Details--like not being forewarned that the pool was closed for renovation, the overpowering smell of the deodorizers in the hallway and room, a worn school folder for the stapled menu and ratty photocopies of other information, and the lack of a top sheet on my bed--leave a sour taste for a $199 room. It could be that the nicer more expensive rooms are, well, nicer. The management company really should get its act together fast because it is almost there. I found all the staff really eager and helpful except, interestingly a front desk manager-type who was obviously sick of the service industry, waiting for that big break. On the flip side, the rooms are very recently redecorated, (this is not your grandmother's hotel) have CD players, down comforters, room service was outstanding (the food and the service) and the vibe is retro/funky/cool. The include a hip jazz/house music CD in the room to give you some of the background music that you hear in the lobby as you check in. The restaurant and bar look nice, although I did the room service option. The lobby is really grand. I hate L.A., so most of my negative feelings stemmed from feeling like I needed a bath the minute I got into the hotel just from riding there from the airport. The neighborhood is not nice but it IS Hollywood...the Walk of Fame, the Chinese Theatre, the tacky souvenir shops, and newer nicer stores at Hollywood and Highland's new mall. If your expectations are sufficiently lowered from "luxury" to "nice" and you aren't too sensitive or detail-driven, the Roosevelt is alright.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to have stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 25 - 29 November, 2004. I had researched this site previously and the reviews seemed to come up Ok with exception of a warning about the mini bar. I kept a small containter of milk in the bar for use in our coffee (they only have powdered stuff - YUK!) and when vacating the room I removed the container and attempted to relock the bar with the key provided, only to have a shelf collapse and a bottle of beer break. I informed reception/housekeeping. I also told the desk clerk upon checking out that I was not prepared to pay for this. Guess what! I was charged over $AUD8.00 for a small bottle. Nonetheless I am disputing this. We also very distressed by our treatment by the staff. There was a Christmas Parade involving all the major streets in the area and most were closed off. We were made to feel like gatecrashers at own hotel and most certainly not put first. The rooms are old and tacky and as for the bathroom I don't even want to go down that road. We have visited this hotel briefly previously prior to their renovation and thought it was just delightful, but unfortunately the new style is just cold and boring and not worth the tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever your standards lower them”
Reviews.Author: ReedyBarnsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 6th to 11th 2004 and overall I would have to say what a let down it was. The room we stayed in had been recently refurbished and apart from the carpet that must have been fitted in the 30's it was acceptable. I suppose we were lucky in that we had hired a car and only used the hotel as somewhere to sleep. Anyway a few of the bad points - if you can speak spanish or ukranian you'll at least be able to talk to the staff otherwise take an interpreter. One day I lost a jumper in the hotel and could not find one person that understood me - now I know I'm from Yorkshire but come on. To be fair there must be one English speaking person that works there because they rang our room at 3.45am one morning and asked us not to use the faucet because they had a flood in the room below ours. The hotel seems to mainly cater for various functions that seem to happen every night and paying foreign tourists are just an unwelcome inconvenience. Obviously these are only my opinions and we still had a great time in LA, but do yourself a favour and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No Oscars here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you hope for luxury and grandeur forget this one. Horrible back entrance to reception. The front lobby from the Boulevard is cold, souless and dark. The facilities are non existent. Small bar with a few chairs in a lounge more like a cave. Forget chilling out, in fact the hotel treats guests second best. Only seem interested in premieres and functions so for two nights out of three the bar was off limits to the guests. Didn't try the restaurant as it seemed overpriced. Rooms in the Tower are bland, cold and feel like a hospital. Tower is always noisy as the air con vents are outside. Staff are hopeless and quite unfriendly and don't seem to understand English. Beware the rude and careless car valets, our rental car was smashed up the last night, some arguing got us a result but they hoped they'd get away with it! Mind you if you've got a limo that's different. Abysmal, dreary and cold. We stayed three nights and it was three too many!! Go to a Best Western far, far superior in every way. In fact just skip Hollywood there's nothing there but tacky gift shops, seedy sex clubs and a feeling of unease at night.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to go again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt last January while in Holloywood for a convention. I loved it. My room was beautiful...modern...a separate shower, tiled bath, windows looking over the street. Others at the convention stayed at the hotel connected to the mall across the street. At the time Ryan Seacrest was taping his TV show outside at the mall. Fantastic area...especially the hotel! I do think that all of the rooms are not as nice as the one I had. Maybe, they haven't finished all of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site we were a little worried about are choice of hotel and boy were we right, the hotel reception is at the back of the hotel and wasn't to bad, but a little anoyed that you could only use the front entrance at certain times. The hotel is more interested in the functions that they have, then for the guests staying there. When we got to are room it was more like a hostel room than a hotel room and the bathroom you couldn't swing a cat in it, when we asked to be moved to a bigger room the response was we wil try, I gave up in the end, we only stayed there 4 nights, but 4 nights to many, would not return and would not recommend this hotel to any one, very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for two days in September 2004 and found it to be a pleasant hotel in a good location. Check-in was efficient and I was offered a choice of rooms. Being from way out of town (8,000 miles out of town), the lady was very helpful and suggested a room on the eighth floor (quieter up there) with a view across Hollywood Boulevard. The room was bright, spacious, modern and comfortable, with plenty of storage space, walk-through dressing room, safe, and nice touches like a coffee percolator. It felt clean and was serviced unobtrusively. My travel agent who booked the room in June told me in July about the renovations and closure of the pool, and they were not a problem. If I'd wanted to use a pool they offered an alternative hotel nearby. I had dinner one evening in the restaurant and, apart from the standard American propensity for rushed meals, it was a pleasant experience - interesting food, friendly and helpful service, a good wine list, and the historic ambience. The only negative experience was on the final day. I'd had my bags collected and stored in the morning, spent a great day at Universal City, then returned to the hotel to pick up my bags and get a taxi to LAX. I think the desk man must have had a deal going with a company on another planet because once he'd phoned for the taxi he made no effort to get my bags, told me there was no hurry, and got on with his work. Meanwhile I watched plenty of empty taxis cruise past the hotel while I waited 40 minutes for mine to arrive. When we got to LAX the driver seemed lost and had no idea where to find the correct terminal. an unfortunate end to an otherwise pleasant stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “oh how it has changed!”
Reviews.Author: iluvla
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the Roosevelt many times over the years and last year will probably be the last time unless there is a change in ownership.We have seen this once beautiful old hotel,loose all it's character as it was gutted in the name of modernisation.Gone are the comfortable furniture to be replaced by hard,plain and ugly chinese style stuff.We lost count how many times we banged our shins on the awful bed,whose mattress was too small for the frame,and oh so low.The wonderful art deco was replaced by bamboo sticks,but worst of all the lobby was cleared of seating for the guests and hired out to private functions,while guests were driven into what once was the basement and is now the reception area,small and like sitting in a pit,we sat and watched the complaints from other guests fall on deaf ears.It was impossible to sit in the evening and have a drink at the small bar as there were only a few chairs or high bar stools.Front doors were locked every time a private party took over the old lobby so we had to walk around to the back door and dodge cars as we crossed the carpark.The mezzanine,which had once had a display of pictures showing the history of hollywood,was reduced to a drafty open gutted space,said to be a bar one day.. All the friendly staff who had been there for years left,to be replaced by others who seemed more and more stretched to service the private functions rather than the guests actually staying in the hotel. This is a hotel that has completely lost it's way..is it a hotel or a collection of function rooms? What really has angered us is the fact the hotel's website is SO misleading,not a word about the still ongoing building work...it's been at least 3 years now since it started and still isnt completed.We doubt it ever will be.It is sad as we really loved the old Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
