Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 night whilst on our honeymoon and our first impressions were very good, however after a long check in with rude staff we arrived on 4 floor which looked like prison cells, the room was ok apart from the maids trying to get in at 8 in the morning!! Location was good however stayed there 5 days too long.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The management should be censured for neglecting to tell hotel guests that their swimming pool is under construction and will not be available until late fall. At no time during the reservations process did they divulge this critical bit of information, and it does not appear anywhere on their hotel web site. Shame on you!

Reviews.Title: “Photo with Charlie is a must”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic, opposite the Chinese theatre and Kodak Cinema. The hotel had been updated, but our room which was by the poolside was a bit grubby to say the least. It was supposed to be non smoking but we could smell smoke, perhaps it was the maid! Staff on the whole were friendly and helpful however, do not book trips with them, you'll get a better deal across the road at the Chinese theatre. LA, well worth a visit and this hotel was in the heart of Hollywood, when its refurbishment is complete it may well be worth a revisit or perhaps ask for a room thats not by the pool. The history of the hotel was brilliant, you can imagine those stars of the past walking through it and I think everyone probably has a photo with Charlie Chaplin in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here July 2003. I am a bit concerned about all the bad reviews on this website as we thought the hotel was fantastic!! This hotel was our first stop on a tour of california and nevada and we were waking very early in the mornings from Jet lag. We had a cabana room and were right next to the jacuzzi. It was great to get up at 6am and open the patio door straight into the jacuzzi when noone was around. The breakfast was fantastic and we had the time of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel,great location, but:”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 17,2004 through June 22 and this hotel was in a great location in hollywood,and it was very historic and interesting place,however the pool area was closed along with the cabana bar area that we were looking foward to that was advertised on all web sites and they put us in a small room at first with a small bed,however they did let us change rooms. some one from the hotel came into our room at 2:30a.m. and scared the crap out of us while we were asleep. also they had NO DRINK MACHINES!!!!!! Everyone there was very nice and courtious,especially the valet people even though it cost $18 a day. I would probably stay there again when the pool is finished.

Reviews.Title: “great location but no pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took this trip to cheer up my mother you just lost her husband. She has always been intrigued by Hollywood. The location of this hotel was great for star watching, as is close to Mann's Chinese theater, the Kodak theatre were they have the Oscars and the El Capitan were Disney holds it's premiers. Our room was clean comfortable with a spacious bathroom and a view of the Hollywood sign as well as Mann's. The front desk staff was courteous and helpful. When our room key was accidentally deactivated, security responded promptly. The room service staff was great. My only complaint is that the pool and Tropicana bar that they mentioned frequently on their website is closed from June through Aug of 2004 and nobody mentioned that on the website or at the time of booking. If you want to swim or sunbathe pick another hotel this summer. Other then the closed pool disappointment , I would stay at this hotel again. The metro station is located within one block of the hotel and is cheap and easy to use . At hollywood and highland roads is a nice shopping and dining complex that is well lit and safe to be in at night.

Reviews.Title: “awful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel at midnight after a flight from Alaska. Hoped that what I had read up about this hotel it would be so interesting to see where all the famous people and the Oscars were first presented and history. What a disappointment, the staff were non-chalant and uncaring. The first room they showed us was so small we asked for an upgrade which we got. We only stayed a night as we were to carry on with our journey, which was good. The staff were not very helpful at all when we asked for brochures about what to see and places of interest. They gave us a tatty photocopied map and a list of things. Other places we stayed had at least a free book of all the attractions. We heard after we had booked here that it was in a dirty area and tried to change but were unfortunately locked in to the itinerary. We placed our luggage in the bell boy's locker when we vacated the room and went to explore. When we got back to the hotel to catch the shuttle back to the airport we could not find the bell boy and it took several minutes to find someone to get our luggage. The shuttle was late to pick us up also and it was a rush to the airport. At the airport it was terrible, with the checking of the luggage as everything had to go through xray machines, unlocked. We booked out luggage in and then had to take it back to this xray machine. We stood at least for half an hour even more to get through this. We had not much time to get onto the plane for our next destination. I think that the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel is a bit of a dump, even though it is being refurbished. All the things that I had read up on that should have been there had been removed somewhere else. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great history”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here in late May very much. The rooms have been remodeled and are very nice, with a sort of funky Asian look. The bathrooms are especially neat. The rest of the building has a wonderful retro feel--they have done a nice job restoring the original decor. The location can't be beat if you are a Hollywood tourist and the history of the place makes your stay so much more interesting than staying in a chain hotel. My only complaint would be the $18 a day charge for parking, although the valet service was very quick and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable and neat without all the frills. I was a little nervous about booking because it was the only hotel left with rooms on a busy LA weekend. But, I was pleased to find helpful staff, a clean and stylish room, and a great view of Hollywood. The location is perfect if you are looking to walk to dinner or a movie, or just check out the walk of stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood in the Old Tradition”
Reviews.Author: cjennt
Reviews.Content: Sure, you could stay at the more exalted Beverly Hills Hotel, but if you want the quintessential Hollywood experience, this is the place! I have stayed both in the pool cabaÃ±a villa and in the main tower. I much prefer and would recommend the cabaÃ±a; as the room is much more spacious and comfortable, not to mention quiet, except for pool noise which might be a problem in summer. The hotel is a historic wonder and is strategically placed in the heart of Hollywood Blvd. with Graumann's Chinese theater and other attractions, Walk of Fame within easy walking distance. The lobby area has the old Hollywood flavor coupled with 1920's style architecture and Spanish influences throughout; the hotel dates from 1927, the year of the first "talking" picture. The mezzanine level is a tribute to Hollywood history and is worth a look in itself. The famed Cinegrill in the Blossom Room was the site of the first Academy awards back in the late 1920's or early '30s. This hotel was literally a clubhouse for the likes of Errol Flynn who purportedly invented his recipe for gin in the backroom of the ex-barbershop. Nearly every star has trysted here, including Marilyn Monroe and the hotel has attracted famous politicians and literary figures like Ernest Hemingway. All in all, a fascinating place to stay and good service as well. Remember, get a room in the cabaÃ±a area; it's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this hotel is fantastic! The location is great, right on the walk of fame. The room was spacious and very clean. There was even a premier party there one night! we did have a problem with an overflow in the toilet, but it was cleared up quickly and we had a complimentary breakfast for our trouble. (which was delicious) I recommend this hotel to anyone, it was beautiful, with an excellent view and lovely pool. The staff were helpful and polite and I enjoyed my stay so much, I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JACKIEMCCANDLESS
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell people that if it is their first time in hollywood this hotel is excellent. Yes I do agree that this area can be quite dangerous at night but during the day what better place to stay. There are so many attractions, you can go acrosss to the chinese theatre, walk the walk of fame, get a tour from outside the chinese theatre(strongly reccommend ask for the tour guide Brian i think.) go shopping, and all the other attractions that this area has. At night get a taxi to the places where you would like to eat. As for the hotel we thought it was excellent. We were lucky enough to stay in Marlyin Monroe's old cabana room, which hasn't changed from she stayed there. Yes a lot of the furniture was from the 1950's but if it was good enough for her it was good enough for me???? The staff were excellent they were very helpful when we needed directions and places to go to a night. Try this hotel for yourself..
